programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a spate of garden thefts, focusing his inquiries on a horticultural landscaper whose business has blossomed since the robberies began. Drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As more facts emerge about the previous night's incident, solicitor Martin Porter finds himself a suspect in the serial killer investigation, despite his protestations of innocence. programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Struggling from the news that Dominic is her half-brother, Chloe is forced to operate with him and Ange, but can they work through their personal pain? Lofty returns to Holby with a secret, but will his reunion with Dominic be a joyful one? And Sacha decides it's time to move back to his own home, but Jac isn't convinced he's ready

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Alicia struggles to process the events of her night with Eddie, and collapses at work after refusing to take a break. Just as she starts to open up to Ethan about her problems, Elle interrupts. A girl breaks out of her house to run away with her boyfriend, but the coach they are travelling on crashes, while Jacob is determined to get Blake to study

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: In the first of two episodes tonight, Chandler tries to maintain an outward veneer of respectability by marrying Debbie McAllister, but reckons without the persistence of a vengeful Mickey Webb, who continues working behind the scenes to end his career. Drummond and Hunter pose as decorators to carry out a surveillance operation, and profiler David Chiu arrives at Sun Hill to help with the serial killer investigation - much to the dismay of acting DI Sam Nixon, who already has a suspect in her sights

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil's at odds with Lisa over Louise. Sonia surprises Gus

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Everything depends on Jamie - will he keep quiet?

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: A private investigator spies on Leo and Abby. Meanwhile, Ken schemes against Sir Edward, and Charles questions Sarah's loyalty

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. While in Venice investigating his friend's death, Lovejoy discovers that not only is the beautiful Caterina saving art for herself rather than posterity, but so too is her sister Lavinia. Fulton Mackay, Gwen Humble and Haydn Gwynne guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Will suffers the heartache of learning his son has been involved in a serious accident on the school rugby field, while Jack returns from Africa and barely has chance to unpack before he is called out to an attempted suicide. Rural medical drama, starring Kevin Whately, Amanda Burton and Simon Shepherd

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following a spate of thefts, Gordon hides in the ladies' changing room in a bid to catch whoever is responsible. A stressed Helen urges Gordon to accompany her to the doctor, so he tasks Colin with replacing him on surveillance duties. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: While Richard contends with the idea of taking early retirement, Hyacinth telephones the prime minister asking if there is anything on the honours list for him. The hen-pecked husband's reservations about the future intensify when he discovers all the plans his spouse has in store for him. Comedy, starring Clive Swift and Patricia Routledge

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Nora Batty is seen without her wrinkled stockings on, fuelling rumours that Compo might have a rival for her affections. When, she is later observed in the pub with another man, local tongues start wagging in earnest. Rural comedy, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg and his friends try to draw Gough away from his wife of 50 years for a bit of fun. Rural comedy, with Peter Sallis, Bill Owen, Michael Aldridge and Cardew Robinson

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth encounters a voodoo priest who is intent on winning back the woman he loves - no matter the cost. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Canon Fox announces that the Duke of Frome will be staying with Lady Felicia at Montague and attending a full Christmas Mass at St Mary's. Father Brown and Mrs McCarthy set about making the arrangements, but when the donkey goes missing, laryngitis hits the choir and a tramp is found sleeping in the confessional box, it looks like Fox's plans are set to be thwarted. Lady Felicia welcomes her cousin the Duke, his wife and baby to the house, but later a nursemaid discovers that the infant is missing from his cot beside a heavily sleeping Nanny Langton. Mark Williams stars

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens a 20-year-old case when a camera and film belonging to a photographic lab assistant murdered in 1987 are found by chance in a Soho pub toilet. New evidence leads the detectives into the world of modelling and to the door of a professional footballer. Meanwhile, Brian's erratic behaviour takes an alarming turn, and Gerry is less than happy when his daughter Emily (played by Dennis Waterman's real-life daughter Hannah) joins the team and looks to Sandra as a role model

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra loses her trust in the others when she discovers they have withheld information concerning her father. The revelation he committed suicide while under investigation for corruption causes her to doubt everything she took for granted, but she tries to set her feelings aside when asked to look into the death of a circus ringmaster

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Blushing bride Di gets ready to whisk Fenner down the aisle as she hands out invitations for their wedding, while Sylvia 'Bodybag' Hollamby searches for a date for the big day. The tension is all too much for poor Milly, who is ready to buckle under unrelenting pressure from an increasingly desperate Selena - leading to tragedy. Kris's appeal hits yet another setback when Frances discovers the truth about her past, and Neil Grayling's private detective digs for dirt on Fenner

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars

programme.title: Doctor Finlay

Highland medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie

programme.desc: Following Brokenwood's first drum 'n' bass festival, the van belonging to the band Starscraper suddenly explodes seemingly from the volume of the music it was playing

programme.title: Pie in the Sky

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Part one of two. Crabbe leaves the restaurant behind for a day at the races, but his fun is cut short by the discovery of a stable lad's dead body. Starring Richard Griffiths, Samantha Womack, Maggie Steed and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Part two of two. Detective-cum-chef Henry Crabbe continues his investigations into the murder of a stable-hand, but faces pressure from Fisher as a second body is discovered. Meanwhile, the friendship between Margaret and Bob Bishop arouses suspicion. Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed star

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A schoolgirl's killing brings Gently into the alien world of pop and media celebrity when it turns out the victim's best friend is a rising TV star. Bacchus suspects the dead girl's music teacher, since rumours persist that she was having an affair with him. But when it seems everyone has a different opinion of the girl, Gently must uncover these different faces to get to the truth of her murder. Neil Morrissey guest stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby

programme.title: Mrs Wilson
programme.desc: Alison is on the tail of the elusive Dorothy - finding photographs of her from Alec's stint in India. After speaking to Alec's handler Coleman and hearing that their 'relationship' was likely a cover story, Alison traces Dorothy to Yorkshire and demands to hear the truth. Back in the 1940s, Alison struggles with the aftermath of Alec's decisions, forced to raise her poverty-stricken young family in wartime London. Drama, starring Ruth Wilson, Iain Glen and Keeley Hawes

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A schoolgirl's killing brings Gently into the alien world of pop and media celebrity when it turns out the victim's best friend is a rising TV star. But when it seems everyone has a different opinion of the girl, Gently must uncover these different faces to get to the truth of her murder. Neil Morrissey guest stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby

programme.title: Dancing on the Edge
programme.desc: Drama by Stephen Poliakoff following the fortunes of a black jazz band in early-1930s London. Music journalist Stanley Mitchell decides to take a gamble and signs Louis Lester and his group, booking them to play at the Imperial Hotel in front of a mainly elderly audience who have never seen black musicians before, and many of whom depart in outrage. However, they do intrigue and impress a group of socialites and are invited to play at a private party - where Prince George flirts with singers Jessie and Carla - and catch the attention of wealthy businessman Mr Masterson. Starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Matthew Goode and John Goodman

programme.title: Dancing on the Edge
programme.desc: Louis is introduced to wealthy recluse Lady Lavinia Cremone, who arranges for the band to play in front of Prince George and invites a producer from the BBC and a record company executive. Singer Jessie is flattered when she attracts the attention of aristocrat Julian Luscombe, who takes her out for a spin in his new car and promises to introduce her to a Hollywood film producer. Starring Jacqueline Bisset, Tom Hughes and Angel Coulby

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon, Tracey and Dorien manage to convince themselves Princess Diana has bought a local mansion, and enthusiastically prepare for the arrival of royal neighbours - will their attempts to raise Chigwell's social standing end in tears? Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A decomposing body in a flat leaves Stamp and Best with a baffling challenge to trace the dead man's wife - if she ever existed. Webb returns to Sun Hill and soon spots Debbie's little secret, informing the whole station of her good news. Bradford finds herself in deep trouble for passing on information that led to Samina's abduction, while Chandler panics as time starts to run out and he still can't back up his alibi

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: With the Sun Hill serial killer still at large, Lennox and Nixon are ready to pounce on any lead no matter how tenuous - so when a foul-tempered member of the public implicates his neighbour, they rush to investigate. Meanwhile, Meadows is on the horns of a dilemma - he's still determined to bring down Chandler but is equally anxious to protect the pregnant McAllister

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Chandler upsets Anne Merrick's daughter by going to the funeral and Meadows takes the opportunity to lean hard on the superintendent's unstable brother James for his version of the rape story. Best discovers physical abuse is going on in his own family, Drummond and Sharpe team up to solve a violent robbery case and a seemingly petty incident of disorderly behaviour unexpectedly throws up a new lead in the hunt for the serial killer

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As more facts emerge about the previous night's incident, solicitor Martin Porter finds himself a suspect in the serial killer investigation, despite his protestations of innocence. McAllister feels increasingly uneasy at fiance Chandler's rash decisions, and the signs look even more ominous for their future together when the superintendent's brother James is found staggering in the road, seemingly intent on being arrested

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Wingless Bird
programme.desc: Feature-length melodrama set in 1913, about the romantic relationship between Agnes Conway, whose parents own a sweetshop, and Charles Farrier, son of an altogether grander family. Agnes faces an added dilemma when she finds her heart divided between Charles and his soldier brother Reginald. Starring Claire Skinner and Edward Atterton

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The shrewd spinster is sent to convalesce in the tropical paradise of Barbados, where she finds life decidedly dull - until a grisly double murder breaks the monotony and presents her with an unforeseen opportunity to do some serious sleuthing. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Donald Pleasence and Adrian Lukis

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: Angry artist Agatha Troy is determined to unmask the forger who is faking her paintings. Inspector Alleyn finds time to alert her to the possible danger involved in her search, but has to concentrate his detecting energies on the case of a corpse found in a tranquil spot outside the home of Percival Pyke Period. A fractious party of lunch guests provides the necessary pool of suspects. With guest stars John Gielgud, Geoffrey Palmer and Belinda Lang

programme.title: McMafia
programme.desc: Alex believes Vadim is still a threat despite Semiyon's fortunes continuing to rise - until he is arrested in Tel Aviv. This new development disrupts Alex and Rebecca's engagement celebrations, forcing Alex to fly out to Israel and try to resolve the crisis. However, Semiyon's plight presents a despairing Lyudmilla with fresh hope, and she seeks to use this opportunity to regain her freedom. Masha confesses her secret to Katya, while Rebecca grows closer to Antonio while her fiance is out of the country

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: With his friend in peril and a young woman kidnapped by the relentless serial killer, can Luther protect the innocent while preventing Cornelius's violent revenge from consuming him? Who is Luther willing to save, and who can't he bear to lose? Crime drama, starring Idris Elba and Ruth Wilson

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Drama from the pen of Sally Wainwright. Catherine Cawood is the sergeant on duty when accountant Kevin Weatherill enters her police station to report a crime - the kidnapping of his boss's daughter. Although he originally came up with the plan as a way of paying for his children's private education, he eventually backed out. However, his partner is dangerous local drug kingpin Ashley Cowgill - and he has gone ahead with the plot anyway. The case hits a nerve for Catherine, who has lost her own daughter and is determined to bring the captors to justice. Sarah Lancashire stars, with Steve Pemberton, Joe Armstrong, James Norton, Siobhan Finneran and George Costigan

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: After the death of Ludovico's wife, Leonardo is given a new art commission. Testing his creativity and trialling a new technique, he must also deal with political unrest

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: Returning to Florence, an uninspired Leonardo accepts to paint the portrait of Lisa Gherardini, that will become the Mona Lisa

programme.desc: A boat show is held in the marina, and Dad buys Nico and Rene a brand new scarf each

programme.title: Digbi Draig

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Stephen Mangan, Charlotte Church, Sam Quek, Nihal Arthanayake, Kate Humble, Rosie Ramsey and Keith Brymer Jones

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a comedians' edition of the general knowledge quiz. Rosie Holt, Nabil Abdulrashid, Shaparak Khorsandi, Mark Steel, Lou Sanders, Luke McQueen, Amy Gledhill and Chris Cantrill try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win money for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Robyn stands up to Jacob and Marty and David struggle to put patient-care first. Elsewhere, Iain and Faith are forced to work closer than ever before. Starring Amanda Henderson, Charles Venn and Derek Thompson

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Toby organises a sponsored parachute jump to raise money for a children's ward in his hospital, so Lee, Lucy, Anna and the grandparents all agree to take part to support him. But once airborne, will everyone pluck up the courage to jump? Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Crystal Palace v Manchester City at Selhurst Park and Bournemouth v Liverpool at Vitality Stadium. An Erling Haaland hat-trick helped the Citizens come back from 2-0 down when they hosted Palace in August, while Liverpool claimed a Premier record-equalling 9-0 win when they faced the Cherries at Anfield. Plus, Everton v Brentford, Leeds United v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leicester City v Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur v Nottingham Forest

programme.title: At Any Price (2012)
programme.desc: A farmer strives to grow his family business by any means necessary, but his rebellious youngest son proves a constant disappointment, more interested in pursuing a career as a racing driver than helping with the farm. When a series of crises threaten the family's future, father and son must learn to put aside their differences to avert the disaster. Drama, starring Dennis Quaid and Zac Efron

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley meets Gloucester Cathedral's stonemasons, and Gemma Hunt meets a woman whose recovery from addiction led her to find faith, which helps her to support others

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Matt's antique vibration device is sure to create a buzz in the Bidding Room. Will the bizarre Victorian medical device reach his desired price? Nigel Havers also meets Samantha and Joshua, who are hoping to sell their art deco cinema seat to fund a holiday

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Ireland (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the final match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. After impressive victories over England and Wales, Scotland tasted defeat for the first time in the campaign last time out when they lost 32-21 to France in Paris. That result left Ireland as the one team still in with a chance of the Grand Slam, and they will be hopeful of emulating their 26-5 triumph over the Scots in Dublin last year. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay, and Tommy Bowe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores British woodland, grassland, freshwater and ocean habitats, revealing the surprising and dramatic wildlife that exist right on the doorstep, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe. The first episode examines the benefits of Britain's natural geology and examines ways in which depleted islands can be restored for future generations

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Belmont House in Kent, where she encounters a disguised Michael McIntyre preparing a prank for his Saturday night show. Items brought in to be valued include an early David Hockney painting, a trophy awarded to Take That in 1995, a sword that once belonged to a member of the Dervish religious order, and a telegram announcing the end of the Second World War

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer sets up his timeshare business in Tenerife. When his passport expires, he is warned about his arrest and flees to Brazil. The police find details of a foreign bank account that has been laundering Brink's-Mat proceeds, and Boyce is sent to Switzerland on a mission to learn who controls it. McAvoy dreams up a prison escape plan, while Cooper and Parry are lured into a trap as the money is traced back to them

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from today's Premier League fixtures, including Fulham v Arsenal at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. The Gunners faced a test of their title credentials away to a Fulham side that have impressed this season, while United will have expected three points against the struggling Saints. Plus, Newcastle United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and West Ham United v Aston Villa

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Chelsea v Manchester United, Arsenal v Reading and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Rugby union player Danny Cipriani, W Series World Champion Jamie Chadwick, former Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips and Commonwealth gold medal-winning weightlifter Zoe Smith join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley hears from people who have given up their time to help others, including the UK's youngest chief executive and a couple who offered their home to a Syrian refugee

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: A mooring structure on the Isle of Wight ferries is in desperate need of repair, bringing the entire terminal to a standstill. The dive team arrive to repair the seaworn structure, working day and night to get the job done on time, but the task is made worse when they come across a mountain of discarded rubbish ranging from teacups to prams

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneer Izzie Balmer and jewellery expert Ishy Khan explore the county of Yorkshire, pointing their vintage golden Volvo towards the likes of Knaresborough, York and Harrogate, before heading south for their third auction. They also discover an awful lot of fascinating history along the way, including a trip to a spa and the little-known story of a woman who played a part in setting up some 200 schools around the world

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the drought ends and the land returns to its former beauty, newborn giraffe Twiga takes his tentative first steps, trying to control his gangly legs - and he must learn quickly as lioness Kali is on the prowl. Another baby enters the elephant herd, and shortly after the newborn's father appears to greet his son in an awe-inspiring moment. Mafuta and the rest of the hippos return to the river, only to find the crocodiles have laid claim to the riverbank - so the hippos try to evict their old enemies

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the popularity of takeaway food in Britain and discuss the various ways that it has evolved over the years. The culinary duo also rustle up some of their favourite dishes

programme.title: Gorilla Family and Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Buchanan returns to the Democratic Republic of Congo in the hope of finding the gorilla family again, and discovering the outcome of silverback Chimanuka's confrontation with a rival. He soon finds the apes, but discovers their lives are now under threat from poachers, and works with the local rangers to prevent them coming to harm

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents more memorable moments from the long-running programme. Veteran experts discuss how they developed their sales patter, while jewellery specialist John Benjamin recalls a memorable visitor to the show in Belfast

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Croome stately home in Worcestershire, where Natasha Raskin Sharp eyes ceremonial gold epaulettes and David Fletcher comes across an unusual vase

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glenn Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson keep their eyes on the prize as Richard Osman reveals who is the week's winner

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team are charged with clearing abandoned boats causing an eyesore and navigational hazard in a picturesque part of the river. Facing the threat of dangerous chemicals, metal boats and lots of mud the team must chase the tide in what is one of the most unusual daily commutes. But when disaster strikes, the divers are left stranded into the night on one of their most challenging jobs yet

programme.title: Back in Time for Birmingham
programme.desc: Noreen and Yasmin Khan join the Sharma family with their friends for a party to mark two events - Divali and the very English tradition of Bonfire Night. They reflect on what they've learned by exploring their family and cultural history and toast their Back in Time experience

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Another look back at some highlights from the show, as Monty Don demonstrates how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man whose beachfront plots are at the constant mercy of the sea, and Arit Anderson meets a woman on a mission to 'green up' neglected urban spaces

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Documentary charting the life and career of the Mexican artist, beginning with her early years when a young Frida grew up in a time of revolution. The programme looks at her rebellious schooldays and a fateful encounter with Diego Rivera, then one of the world's most famous artists and the man who would change her life

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee hosts this episode of the comedy showcase recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, featuring stand-up performances by New York-based Edinburgh comedy award winner Alex Edelman, and at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe Comedians' Choice Award winner Lou Sanders

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Christian Fraser

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Orna and Dale investigate his aversion to India's expressions of anger, and a minor squabble between Molly and Josh leads to an explosive revelation

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Orna confronts Will about his lack of engagement with Ping, while Molly and Josh deal with the fallout from their previous session. A startling comment from Cyn threatens her renewed connection to Yaya

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: The rapper prepares to open a show for big-name star Meek Mill. He asks GaTa to be his hype man on stage. However, as GaTa's behaviour becomes more and more erratic, it may be impossible to keep his biggest secret from his new friends

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: The rapper and his crew travel to his home town of Philadelphia, where he is about to give his first big live show as opening act for Meek Mill

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Marianna Spring reports on how Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter is transforming one the world's most influential social media platforms. Current and former insiders in San Francisco and the UK reveal how hate and misogyny are thriving under the new owner, following the dismissal of thousands of staff and the reinstatement of users previously banned for breaking Twitter's rules

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Louis supports the rebel colonies in America against France's old enemy, England, despite misgivings at court. Though still with no son, Antoinette moves to the Petite Trianon, where life is less formal. Then a face from the past, Swedish noble Count Fersen, arrives, complicating matters

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: After Blackbeard's old pal Calico Jack pays a visit to the Revenge, Stede begins to feel like a third wheel. In his despair over Jim's absence, Oluwande gives his room to Frenchie and Wee Jack, who relish the opportunity to design their new space. Meanwhile, Jim returns to Jackie's for more information on the men they seek

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels are at the clubhouse playing, but they cannot stop thinking about the dreams they had last night

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels have a picnic and notice that the chickens eat differently than they do

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea and Supertato face each other in a dance-off

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: The flock fails to recognise Shaun when he loses one his most distinctive features

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: The friends produce a hand-drawn comic that is a surprise hit all round Beanotown, but Walter is envious of their success and embarks on a mission of cartoon-drawing sabotage

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Driven to distraction by boisterous behaviour, Girl decides to move into the Grampavan

programme.title: The Football Academy
programme.desc: The U-11 boys go to the national futsal finals at St George's Park, where midfielder Mitch and attacker Albie hope to bring home glory

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Avanaya from Leicester wants a relaxing, Indian-themed den so she can escape her three cricket-loving brothers, and to remind her of the times she has spent visiting her grandma

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors supersize the tiny air sacs inside the lungs known as the alveoli

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The new presenter joins the team for the first time

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall swims with sharks, uses time-slice cameras to see what makes the predator's bite so deadly, and dives with the most feared of its species - the great white

programme.title: Life in the Air
programme.desc: Documentary following animals that are able to defy gravity in various ways. The first programme features caracal cats, which jump to catch birds out of the air, and reveals how kangaroos' hopping movements help them find water in the desert. Leaping snakes are able to glide without wings in the jungles of Borneo while insects are able to accelerate up to 700G

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey and the team help the Clark family declutter as they lay out their belongings in a warehouse only to discover they own 521 odd socks, 75 barbies and 28 games controllers. After moving from the US to a much smaller house in the UK the family no longer have the space they need. Carpenter Rob creates some floor to ceiling storage for the family while Dilly reorganises the kitchen and laundry area

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the King Harry ferry to enjoy a crossing voted one of the most scenic in the world, rustles up a vegetarian tart and investigates the Cornish influence on Oscar-Winning composer Malcolm Arnold with Radio 3 presenter Petroc Trewlawny

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: The remaining nine contenders are put through their paces as they face a series of challenges. First, Mary Berry tasks the famous faces to make a chocolate dessert fit for a romantic date night, before the competitors take on Chris Bavin's tricky challenge of rustling up a dish using his favourite cut of leftover meat. The judges must then decide, taking both challenges into account, who is safe and who needs to prove themselves by cooking again in Angela Hartnett's dreaded Eliminator

programme.title: The Ipcress File (1965)
programme.desc: An intelligence agent investigating the kidnap and brainwashing of Britain's most renowned scientists unpicks a complex chain of connections and high-level intrigue, while detecting evidence of double-dealing and counter-espionage. Spy thriller based on Len Deighton's novel, starring Michael Caine, Sue Lloyd, Gordon Jackson and Nigel Green

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: The life of acting legend Michael Caine, star of movies such as The Ipcress File, The Italian Job, and The Dark Knight. Using TV interviews and classic archive clips, this programme tells the story of one of Britain's most successful actors. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Funeral in Berlin (1966)
programme.desc: Former crook and disreputable spy Harry Palmer has to carefully engineer the defection of a Russian officer responsible for safeguarding vital military secrets - but the mission proves less than straightforward. Cold War thriller and the second film to feature Len Deighton's character, starring Michael Caine, Eva Renzi, Oscar Homolka, Paul Hubschmid and Guy Doleman

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Adam Partridge and Christina Trevanion value objects at Hereford Cathedral, while presenter Paul Martin visits a local green wood studio

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Choirmaster Gareth Malone and saxophonist YolanDa Brown hunt for items in Edinburgh and Fife, with experts David Harper and Raj Bisram on hand to advise. Among the items of note are novelty sugar tongs, a Native American drum and a rare green pig

programme.title: Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox continues his exploration of the universe with a journey into darkness. The centre of the galaxy is home to an invisible monster of unimaginable power - a supermassive black hole named Sagittarius A*. Weighing 4 million times the mass of the Sun, it's an object with such an immense gravitational field that nothing can escape - not even light. For decades, black holes existed purely in the minds of theoretical physicists - the idea was so absurd, scientists thought they couldn't possibly exist in nature. But recent astronomical breakthroughs have confirmed not only that black holes like Sagittarius A* exist, but that these bizarre invisible objects may be the ultimate galactic protagonists

programme.title: Dusty Springfield at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of archive appearances on the BBC by singer Dusty Springfield through the decades, including performances of You Don't Have to Say You Love Me, Son of a Preacher Man and The Look of Love.

programme.title: Definitely Dusty
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting the career of Dusty Springfield, the renowned pop diva famous for classic songs such as You Don't Have to Say You Love Me and Son of a Preacher Man. Archive footage shot in both the UK and the US provides an illuminating insight into her glamorous but private personal life, and contributions from her protective inner circle of friends highlight the Dusty behind the panda eyes and blonde beehive. Includes interviews with Tom Jones, Elton John, Burt Bacharach, Lulu and Neil Tennant

programme.title: Dusty Springfield at the Royal Albert Hall
programme.desc: A 1979 concert by the pop singer recorded at the famous London venue in the presence of Princess Margaret. Songs include I Close My Eyes and Count to Ten, All I See Is You, Son of a Preacher Man and You Don't Have to Say You Love Me

programme.title: Dusty Springfield at the BBC
programme.desc: A tribute to the renowned London-born pop diva, featuring BBC archive footage of some of Dusty's most famous performances from 1961 to 1995. The programme also offers a chance to relive the singer's story, from her folk beginnings with the Springfields, through to her Motown homage years and her collaboration with Pet Shop Boys in the late 1980s. Also includes the star's duets with Tom Jones and Mel Torme

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Documentary charting the life and career of the Mexican artist, beginning with her early years when a young Frida grew up in a time of revolution. The programme looks at her rebellious schooldays and a fateful encounter with Diego Rivera, then one of the world's most famous artists and the man who would change her life

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Emma's car is broken into and her laptop is stolen. Meanwhile, Elz, keen to make an impression on Trippie Redd, takes on the role of babysitter

programme.title: A White, White Day (2019)
programme.desc: A recently widowed off duty police chief in a remote Icelandic town becomes obsessed with proving that a neighbour had an affair with his wife. His grief-fulled fixation and growing desire for revenge threaten to cost him everything he has left. Thriller, starring Ingvar Sigurdsson and Ída Mekkín Hlynsdóttir. In Icelandic

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley shares the stories of a Muslim taxi driver driven by his faith to help his community through the pandemic, and a Jewish fire chief who is hoping to inspire others to follow in her footsteps

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Another look back at some highlights from the show, as Monty Don demonstrates how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man whose beachfront plots are at the constant mercy of the sea, and Arit Anderson meets a woman on a mission to 'green up' neglected urban spaces

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Matt Baker are on the east coast of England to find out how storms are devouring the coastline, putting homes and livelihoods at threat. Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: As spring arrives, the horticulturist clears away the last of the winter debris, sows her first seeds and calls an expert in to cloud-prune her box hedging - but work is interrupted by a nesting bird. There is a surge of lush new growth come May and Carol's seedlings need pricking out, and now the frosts are over, the renewal of the garden is once again under way

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwall's mines, from the men who laboured beneath the earth's surface to the young women who earned their living breaking rocks with heavy sledgehammers. He also visits a maker of botanical spirits, and adds a cheeky nip to his clementine trifle

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode continues his alphabetical journey, this time looking at dishes linked by the letter R. Recipes from the archive include Nigel Slater cooking ribs and Raymond Blanc creating rice pudding

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Manchester United (Kick-off 12.30pm). All the action from the top-flight encounter at Kingsmeadow. The Blues are looking to win their fourth consecutive league title, but United are very much in contention to end their run and become champions for the first time in their history

programme.title: The Third Man (1949)
programme.desc: American writer Holly Martins goes to post-Second World War Vienna at the invitation of his old friend Harry Lime, only to find he has died. However, the author finds the circumstances surrounding his death fail to add up and goes in search of the truth - but is unprepared for the ugly secrets he uncovers. Carol Reed's thriller, written by Graham Greene, starring Joseph Cotten, Orson Welles, Alida Valli and Trevor Howard

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Ten aspiring designers compete in the makeover challenge, hoping to get their big break in the world of commercial interior design. Michelle Ogundehin asks them to transform five luxury apartments in London's Elephant and Castle and they must work in pairs, with one in charge of the open-plan kitchen-living room, while the other takes control of the bedrooms. Alan Carr hosts

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team visit Southwell Minster, near Nottingham, where experts Michael Baggott and Caroline Hawley appraise the best items on offer, including a collection of gold that raises the roof and an art deco brooch. Paul also finds time to explore Newstead Abbey, the country seat of poet and Lothario Lord Byron, and finds out that there is more to him and his relationships than meets the eye

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: The key moments from the fourth and penultimate weekend of the championship, featuring England v France, Italy v Wales and Scotland v Ireland

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Giles Coren visit the Yorkshire Dales to work at Swinton Estate, the ancestral home of Lord and Lady Masham. By taking a look the heart of the grand house and its countryside charm, as well as the wider estate, which has opened up to for guests to enjoy, Monica and Giles learn about the challenges of making history pay in the modern world

programme.title: Paul Whitehouse: Our Troubled Rivers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Paul visits the River Wye and discovers how an explosion of algae caused by fertiliser run-off from farming is part of a cocktail overwhelming the habitats along the waterway. He travels to Hampshire where he hears about the damage being caused to rare and precious chalk streams, before discovering how regular sewage discharges on the coast are causing problems for Whitstable's famous oyster industry. Ending his journey in London, Paul finds a beacon of hope in the form of the £4.4billion Thames Tideway super sewer

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: W Kamau Bell's documentary about Bill Cosby's descent from 'America's Dad' to alleged sexual predator examines how the actor and comedian's reputation evolved in the 1970s, when he became an on-screen educator and moral authority - a man thought to be trustworthy

programme.title: Mr. Jones (2019)
programme.desc: In 1933, Welsh journalist Gareth Jones travels to Moscow in the hope of interviewing Joseph Stalin, but instead escapes the city and uncovers evidence of a devastating famine in Ukraine. However, it is not just the Soviets who want word of the terrible reality suppressed. Fact-based drama, starring James Norton

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The documentary continues with the investigation into the sinking of the Rainbow Warrior in May 1985. Just one day after the explosions that sunk the Greenpeace ship, police were overwhelmed with calls from people claiming to have spotted unusual goings on. One witness led to Swiss tourists Alain and Sophie Turenge. They came into the station voluntarily but their inability to answer simple questions led police to doubt their identities

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Dave meets with music company executives while pitching for a record deal. He ends up being introduced to Benny Blanco and Justin Bieber, and gets invited to his first Hollywood party, where he rubs shoulders with Kourtney Kardashian.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in London to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey helps the Viney family declutter their home after grandma Sue filled their house with her deceased mum's belongings and the contents of a recently closed gift shop. Sue's children are desperate for a clear out so they can come over and spend more time with her. The team remove everything from the house including 532 plastic carrier bags, 205 hair rollers, 30 umbrellas, 17 digital cameras and 443 pairs of shoes. While the family sort through what they want to keep, recycle, donate or sell, carpenter Rob installs a pulldown bed for extra space and Dilly reinstates the downstairs as a functioning living and dining space

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: John Peel and Janice Long present the March 7 1985 edition, featuring Shakin' Stevens, Madonna, Jermaine Jackson and Dead or Alive

programme.title: My Name Is Ottilie
programme.desc: Soul singer Dana Masters recounts the story of the 'Godmother of British blues' Ottilie Patterson from her beginning in Muddy Water's blues club in Chicago, her time as the acclaimed singer with the Chris Barber Band to her sudden disappearance from the music industry. Featuring Jools Holland, Jacqui Dankworth, Dick Taylor, Stu Morrison, Ronnie Greer and a never before heard interview with the Co Down-born singer herself

programme.title: Oscar Peterson: Words and Music
programme.desc: Archive programme in which the jazz pianist talks to guests including bandleader and composer Count Basie and guitarist Joe Pass

programme.title: In Concert: Oscar Peterson
programme.desc: Performance by the Oscar Peterson Trio at the Ronnie Scott's Club in 1974, featuring such songs as I Should Care, This Nearly Was Mine, Soulville Summer, On the Trail, Watch What Happens and A Time for Love. Part of Swing season

programme.title: Jazz Piano Gold
programme.desc: Archive footage of performances from 1964 to 2009 by artists including Count Basie, Thelonious Monk, Oscar Peterson, Abdullah Ibrahim, Stan Tracey, Jacques Loussier, Duke Ellington, Return to Forever and Herbie Hancock. Clips are taken from shows such as Jazz 625 and Later with Jools Holland

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents the chart show from April 28, 1994, featuring Ride, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Skin, Eternal, Club House, Level 42, Barbra Streisand, Michael Bolton and Prince

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: Michael begins the third leg of his journey in the mineral-rich state of Minas Gerais, where he learns about the Brazilian mining industry and meets some of the people dedicated to overturning the environmental damage it causes. He then heads to Rio de Janeiro, focus of the next Olympics, where the authorities are ridding the streets of violent drug gangs that have controlled the city's shanty towns. On a lighter note, the globe-trotting broadcaster also learns to celebrate a goal like a well-known radio commentator and visits a 'love hotel'

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey across the South American country, Michael explores the Brazilian south, where he is surprised by the rich diversity of European and Asian influences. Along the way he meets Dom Joao de Orleans e Braganca, second in line of succession to Brazil's defunct throne, goes flying with a man who has made a fortune out of rubbish and meets rap star Criolo, who believes social equality is a distant dream for most of his countrymen. Travelling farther south to Blumenau, the former Python's views on what makes a typical Brazilian are challenged when he finds German speakers and Bavarian dancers, before he catches piranha for sushi and helps cowboys treat a calf attacked by a jaguar

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc: Meg discovers that Adolphe has syphilis and Jouin finally identifies the body found in the park. Cochefert reveals that the dead man is linked to the unsolved murder of a lawyer. Meanwhile, Lepine is troubled by the Dentrement case and considers resigning. In French

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc: Louise Lépine finds an unlikely ally in her attempts to persuade her father to postpone his retirement. Jouin and Cochefert hear testimony from the mother of Paul Cetinet, and Fiersi, now a free agent, talks to one of the maids at Château de Bagatelle. In French

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc: Comedy sketches, with Stephen Fry and Hugh Laurie, featuring a 94-year-old man who realises what he has been missing out on his whole life, the difficulty of concentrating on the Bible and a long-suffering puppy

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean pays an unexpected visit during Lionel's lecture tour - only to be surprised herself. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews
programme.desc: Louis meets the Oscar-winning actress at her home in Surrey for a candid and lively conversation about her long career, her passion for theatre, her life away from acting and her relationship with her husband, the late Michael Williams. Louis also accompanies Judi to the Gielgud Theatre in London's West End, where they discuss the difficulties of the lockdown and how it inadvertently led to her surprise popularity on TikTok

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc: Terry Wogan introduces another edition of the inter-regional dance contest from 1977, which sees the North East compete against the North West at Tiffany's Ballroom, Glasgow. Barri Haynes provides the commentary

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Pianist Martha Argerich performs a piece by Schubert with conductor Daniel Barenboim in an extract from the 2016 Proms. Presented by Katie Derham and Samira Ahmed

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc: The natural world has always been a powerful inspiration to composers. From vast forests and tiny fish to wild storms and epic seascapes, this programme takes viewers on an evocative journey through some of the best-loved musical responses to the living planet. Including works by Vivaldi, Reiner, Vaughan Williams and Debussy

programme.title: Tartuffe
programme.desc: The Birmingham Rep's production of Molière's comedy Tartuffe, updated to the West Midlands, telling the story of a wealthy merchant who makes the mistake of extending the hand of hospitality toward a swindler and hypocrite - with disastrous consequences for his family. Originally staged by the Royal Shakespeare Company, and adapted by Anil Gupta and Richard Pinto, the Bafta-winning duo behind Citizen Khan and Goodness Gracious Me

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Miami
programme.desc: Clive sets out to discover the truth about an American city that was seen as the vice capital of America, teeming with money, illegal aliens and cocaine. He investigates what is beneath the surface, meeting famous resdients in Miami Vice star Don Johnson and singer Gloria Estefan

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary examining how the National Enquirer became the most infamous tabloid in America by churning out obscene stories that blur the lines between truth and fiction

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc: Ade explores Tanzania, Ethiopia, and Somalia, visiting a game reserve where efforts are being made to halt the decline of elephant numbers. He tours Addis Ababa with former Olympic champion Haile Gebrselassie to discover why Ethiopia's economy has gone from strength to strength in recent years, and discovers the impact of war on Somalia, meeting a former NHS doctor who has returned to the country to help rebuild

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces the unique talents of the world's most intelligent animals, investigating how nature's masterminds measure up against human brain power. Looking at a variety of animals, such as ravens, crows, bees and starlings, Chris explores how different animals can use tools, solve complex puzzles, recognise themselves in mirrors and even reason like humans

programme.desc: Nigel, Bailee Bear and Benjee Bair welcome toddlers Romy, Arabella, Eleanor, Musa and Yahya, and their grown-ups to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! The What's in the Box? game reveals a pair of soft toys hugging each other, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are all to do with being kind. This theme is explored through exploration, play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate being kind object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about discovering new words, as Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear explore some of the times when it's good to be kind! programme.desc: It's a snowy day and JoJo and Gran Gran go to the park to build a snow panda! When JoJo realises it won't last forever, Gran Gran has a Gran Gran Plan to help them remember their fun day in the snow.

programme.title: Big Cook Little Cook
programme.desc: Jen is playing with her toy train set, but she really wants to go on a real steam train. Tess the train driver comes to visit, Small flies off to see how leeks grow, and they make a choo-choo party platter for their special guest.

programme.title: Old Jack's Boat: Rockpool Tales
programme.desc: Old Jack remembers when the circus came to Staithes and tells Salty a story about Andrew the Anemone performing the most amazing stunt in the Rockpool show

programme.title: Gecko's Garage
programme.desc: Baby Truck comes into the garage with a wobbly tooth.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are curious about Duggee's prized train set, but struggle to understand that his miniature locomotives are not really toys

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Zim and Zam have discovered the lost city of Micro OKIDO. There is just one problem - it's on the exact spot that Mayor Oki wants to place his new statue. It's up to Messy to help save the city.

programme.title: Bitz & Bob
programme.desc: Bitz needs to complete Mayor Bevel's brand new Mega Wheel without any instructions. CGI action comedy for pre-school children

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: A super rainbow appears in the sky, and Love Monster heads off to find the magic sparkle dust at the end of it

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Everyone in Fluffytown is gathered for a communal nap ahead of the big Siesta Fiesta Day celebration - because the better the nap, the better the party afterwards. Elder Chick demonstrates the Fluffytown nap timer and explains when she presses the button it's time to snooze, and when the hand reaches the balloon, it's time for the Siesta Fiesta. She starts the timer, and everyone hurries off to their nap stations to begin their naps. As the other Fluffytowners start to doze off, Love Monster struggles to fall asleep. After trying a pre-nap workout with Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, practising yoga with Book Cub and pillow drumming with Bad Idea Puppy, a frustrated Love Monster gives up and thinks he might as well start getting ready for the party. He heads over to his decks and puts on a song just before the sleep timer goes off, and everyone awakes full of energy. As everyone boogies to the beats, Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny looks over to the decks, but Love Monster is nowhere to be seen. She

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Pug needs help mending his new see-saw. On their adventure our friends meet a Troll who guards an old bridge so that the goats cannot cross it. Dog persuades the Troll to build a new strong bridge, and then they all cross to the other side.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: The lamb dresses as a doctor, and insists on treating his classmates as patients

programme.title: Something Special

programme.desc: When Pablo goes to sleep at his Granny's, it is too quiet even for a mouse

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Duck keeps oversleeping, so Sarah decides he needs his own alarm clock

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: After accidentally causing a mini avalanche, Messy must help Lofty dig out the entrance to his cave so he can warm up again - brrr!

programme.title: Andy's Global Adventures
programme.desc: Andy, Jen and Scout head off on a global adventure to Borneo in search of orangutans

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, it’s the Peas performing their hap-pea double act and showing that, although they look alike, they definitely don’t think alike.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels learn about an action hero called Jet Rocket who always saves the day by smashing and crashing things. But there are other ways to save the day!

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Aimee and Ashley set sail to ancient Greece and Bobbles has great fun as the one-eyed giant Cyclops. Deep in a dark cave Leapy Lion dressed as Odysseus is hiding from Cyclops. With the help of his animal friends Odysseus and his sailors put on a clever disguise to flee from the monster to their waiting ship

programme.title: Treasure Champs
programme.desc: Barry refuses to admit he has been playing with Kari's building blocks, but as he tells more and more lies, he realises bending the truth can result in people getting hurt

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The girls set up a fancy restaurant for Mum and Dad!

programme.title: Andy's Global Adventures
programme.desc: Andy, Jen and Scout head to South Africa on an adventure in search of African penguins

programme.title: Ranger Hamza's Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how buzzards play such an important role in the environment. They find out that they help nature stay in balance and that buzzards living in an area can tell us if it is a healthy habitat. On the way, they spot buzzards flying in the sky and learn that their wings stretch to the height of a Rambler!

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran are drinking hot chocolate in the park café when a robin lands on their table. JoJo learns that some birds fly away in the winter - that's called migration.

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The adventures of a seven-year-old girl and her duck

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.desc: The duo have a race around the park, and Lola realises it is not necessary to win all the time

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Small notices that the Iron Chicken has become trapped by junk metal that has got caught in orbit around her nest, but Major comes up with a clever solution

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos proudly show everyone their bright white teeth, Makka Pakka arrives to wash their faces and the gang gets involved in a dance at the gazebo

programme.title: Hushabye Lullabye

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley showcase the work of frontline forces and ask for viewers' help on unsolved cases

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A criminal couple use an unusual technique to con people at cashpoints. A would-be robber with a knife underestimates an older female cashier, and a bragging joyrider ends up crashing back down to earth. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin follow the progress of a multi-apartment property in south Wales, a mid-terrace on Merseyside and a ground floor flat in Birmingham

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Brighton Racecourse Antiques Fair, with the help of experts Danny Sebastian and John Cameron, and relives the 1960s with a group of original mods

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Sullivan's dream of leaving Kembleford is scuppered when he is arrested for receiving stolen goods. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring more treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life. Ceramic conservator Kirsten Ramsay carefully restores a cherished but chipped piece of 1960s pottery, but with pieces missing and a highly polished finish to mimic she has her work cut out. A military campaign chest that's been through the wars and two much-loved Dutch chairs in need of caning are also restored

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman embarks on a house-hunting mission in the Shropshire countryside, balancing the dreams of a father who has a £475,000 budget and wants to head for the hills, while his daughter wants him to live closer to a community. Nicki also heads to Wenlock and tries her inexperienced hand at pot-throwing and the Japanese art of raku, a pot-firing technique that produces some dramatic results

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Ishy Balmer visits the first Jain temple in the western world and Izzie Khan discovers the history of folk art. Later, the final auction in Leicestershire, sees broken pineapples, legless glass ladies, mystery board games and an antique pub table - but which items will make the duo some money?

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Intrepid team members Christine, Elaine, Karen and Katie compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Sin Bin
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Gareth Thomas are joined by Strictly Come Dancing judge Anton Du Beke, swimmer Ellie Simmonds and Irish comic Jason Byrne to reflect on this year's Six Nations championship. The show's Sin Bin Road Trip is back in Cardiff as Hal Robson-Kanu and Eleri Sion take on James Hook at place kicking

programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: Documentary following the team at one of the biggest haulage companies in Wales. Trigger's one of a small number of female longdistance HGV drivers. Today, she's due to be taking a delivery from Newport up to Manchester - though a catalogue of disasters mean she's struggling to get out of the starting block. Van driver Gary's got no time to waste as he navigates his way round the streets of Llanelli delivering 120 parcels. Elsewhere, veteran driver Phil aka 'The Donk' gives recently recruited receptionist Jess a crash-course in all things trucking - quite literally - with a day out to the Pembrey Truck Races

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: The peaceful community of Shipton Abbott is rocked when beloved painting the Solo Mare disappears in a seemingly impossible heist while plans are in motion for its appearance at an exhibition. The theft is even more perplexing given the artwork was under the guard of PC Kelby Hartford at the time. Kelby feels responsible and Humphrey pulls out all the stops to recover the priceless piece. Drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Mooney and the team become embroiled in the mysterious world of faith healing when a blind woman dies while being treated by renowned healer Steadman King. When it turns out the victim was poisoned, all eyes turn to Steadman and his cup of holy water. But how could the prime suspect have carried out the deed in front of an audience without anyone noticing? Meanwhile, JP is put through his paces when Pico the police dog joins the team on a week-long trial, and Florence tries to recreate some of Jack's home comforts

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The second of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Tom Hanks, Cate Blanchett, Austin Butler, Michelle Yeoh, Hugh Jackman, Naomi Ackie, Brendan Fraser, Judi Dench, Jamie Dornan, Kate Winslet, Lizzo and Margot Robbie

programme.title: The Wedding Planner (2001)
programme.desc: San Francisco wedding planner Mary Fiore organises other people's nuptials but has never had much luck in love. One day she is swept off her feet by handsome doctor Steve Edison. They spend a magical night together and all seems perfect, but her dreams of him becoming her husband suffer a setback when she discovers she has already been hired to organise his marriage to another woman. Will true love find a way? Director Adam Shankman's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Matthew McConaughey, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Justin Chambers and Joanna Gleason

programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the annual Neath Food and Drink Festival and finds out whether traditional or gourmet Welsh cakes are more popular among the visitors. Cookery writer Michaela Chiappa discovers how seaweed is being harvested for food in Pembrokeshire, Onkar Singh Purewal reveals the secrets of beekeeping, and farmer Meinir Howells finds out how dairy farmers are selling milk direct, while avoiding the supermarkets

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a globetrotting couple to find a new home in the Wiltshire countryside, and also visits an intensive care nurse at her much loved and fruitful allotment

programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Jayne Middlemiss, Neil Delamere, Harpreet Kaur and Amar Latif are in the famous black chair, answering questions on Duran Duran, The Vikings, The Wolf of Wall Street and Sam Cooke

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees Debbie McGee, Katie McGlynn, John Whaite, and Rhys Stephenson taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Stephen Mangan, Charlotte Church, Sam Quek, Nihal Arthanayake, Kate Humble, Rosie Ramsey and Keith Brymer Jones

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a comedians' edition of the general knowledge quiz. Rosie Holt, Nabil Abdulrashid, Shaparak Khorsandi, Mark Steel, Lou Sanders, Luke McQueen, Amy Gledhill and Chris Cantrill try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win money for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Robyn stands up to Jacob and Marty and David struggle to put patient-care first. Elsewhere, Iain and Faith are forced to work closer than ever before. Starring Amanda Henderson, Charles Venn and Derek Thompson

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Toby organises a sponsored parachute jump to raise money for a children's ward in his hospital, so Lee, Lucy, Anna and the grandparents all agree to take part to support him. But once airborne, will everyone pluck up the courage to jump? Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Hugh Dennis

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Crystal Palace v Manchester City at Selhurst Park and Bournemouth v Liverpool at Vitality Stadium. An Erling Haaland hat-trick helped the Citizens come back from 2-0 down when they hosted Palace in August, while Liverpool claimed a Premier record-equalling 9-0 win when they faced the Cherries at Anfield. Plus, Everton v Brentford, Leeds United v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leicester City v Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur v Nottingham Forest

programme.title: At Any Price (2012)
programme.desc: A farmer strives to grow his family business by any means necessary, but his rebellious youngest son proves a constant disappointment, more interested in pursuing a career as a racing driver than helping with the farm. When a series of crises threaten the family's future, father and son must learn to put aside their differences to avert the disaster. Drama, starring Dennis Quaid and Zac Efron
