programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Politics Wales
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate, and reports from around Wales, presented by James Williams

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team of experts bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. First up, Rose Werner and her sister Linda hope that Suzie Fletcher can turn her expertise to a decorative leather box that they hold dear to their hearts. Peter Coxon is next to arrive, hoping the teamwork of Steve Fletcher and Dominic Chinea can provide a speedy recovery to a favourite childhood toy, a tin speed boat. Later, the experts also turn their attention to an Italian dressing table chair and a tortoise pouffe

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A look at how Wales' greatest ever Paralympian, Tanni Grey-Thompson, recovered from the disappointment of failing to medal in the 800m at the 2004 Athens Paralympics, typically her strongest event, by going on to win golds in the 100m and 400m

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley meets Gloucester Cathedral's stonemasons, and Gemma Hunt meets a woman whose recovery from addiction led her to find faith, which helps her to support others

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Matt's antique vibration device is sure to create a buzz in the Bidding Room. Will the bizarre Victorian medical device reach his desired price? Nigel Havers also meets Samantha and Joshua, who are hoping to sell their art deco cinema seat to fund a holiday

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Ireland (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the final match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. After impressive victories over England and Wales, Scotland tasted defeat for the first time in the campaign last time out when they lost 32-21 to France in Paris. That result left Ireland as the one team still in with a chance of the Grand Slam, and they will be hopeful of emulating their 26-5 triumph over the Scots in Dublin last year. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay, and Tommy Bowe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores British woodland, grassland, freshwater and ocean habitats, revealing the surprising and dramatic wildlife that exist right on the doorstep, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe. The first episode examines the benefits of Britain's natural geology and examines ways in which depleted islands can be restored for future generations

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Belmont House in Kent, where she encounters a disguised Michael McIntyre preparing a prank for his Saturday night show. Items brought in to be valued include an early David Hockney painting, a trophy awarded to Take That in 1995, a sword that once belonged to a member of the Dervish religious order, and a telegram announcing the end of the Second World War

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer sets up his timeshare business in Tenerife. When his passport expires, he is warned about his arrest and flees to Brazil. The police find details of a foreign bank account that has been laundering Brink's-Mat proceeds, and Boyce is sent to Switzerland on a mission to learn who controls it. McAvoy dreams up a prison escape plan, while Cooper and Parry are lured into a trap as the money is traced back to them

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from today's Premier League fixtures, including Fulham v Arsenal at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. The Gunners faced a test of their title credentials away to a Fulham side that have impressed this season, while United will have expected three points against the struggling Saints. Plus, Newcastle United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and West Ham United v Aston Villa

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Chelsea v Manchester United, Arsenal v Reading and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.desc: Rugby union player Danny Cipriani, W Series World Champion Jamie Chadwick, former Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips and Commonwealth gold medal-winning weightlifter Zoe Smith join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting of ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.title: The Wedding Planner (2001)
programme.desc: San Francisco wedding planner Mary Fiore organises other people's nuptials but has never had much luck in love. One day she is swept off her feet by handsome doctor Steve Edison. They spend a magical night together and all seems perfect, but her dreams of him becoming her husband suffer a setback when she discovers she has already been hired to organise his marriage to another woman. Will true love find a way? Director Adam Shankman's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Matthew McConaughey, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Justin Chambers and Joanna Gleason

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Georgina Hayden and Julie Lin, plus special guest Sara Cox. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain shares the speediest of her bakes, which are easy enough to rustle up any day of the week. First up, Nadiya shares a nifty hack on an old-school quiche using layers of buttery filo pastry as a speedy base, adorned with an instant punchy paprika egg topping. Next is Nadiya's take on an American favourite she first discovered on a trip to New York, the Snickerdoodle - a cinnamon-and-peanut-encrusted chocolate cookie with a runny caramel surprise in the centre

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Crystal Palace v Manchester City. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Bournemouth and Liverpool

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Jayne Middlemiss, Neil Delamere, Harpreet Kaur and Amar Latif are in the famous black chair, answering questions on Duran Duran, The Vikings, The Wolf of Wall Street and Sam Cooke

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees Debbie McGee, Katie McGlynn, John Whaite, and Rhys Stephenson taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Stephen Mangan, Charlotte Church, Sam Quek, Nihal Arthanayake, Kate Humble, Rosie Ramsey and Keith Brymer Jones

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a comedians' edition of the general knowledge quiz. Rosie Holt, Nabil Abdulrashid, Shaparak Khorsandi, Mark Steel, Lou Sanders, Luke McQueen, Amy Gledhill and Chris Cantrill try to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public to win money for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Robyn stands up to Jacob and Marty and David struggle to put patient-care first. Elsewhere, Iain and Faith are forced to work closer than ever before. Starring Amanda Henderson, Charles Venn and Derek Thompson

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Toby organises a sponsored parachute jump to raise money for a children's ward in his hospital, so Lee, Lucy, Anna and the grandparents all agree to take part to support him. But once airborne, will everyone pluck up the courage to jump? Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Hugh Dennis

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Crystal Palace v Manchester City at Selhurst Park and Bournemouth v Liverpool at Vitality Stadium. An Erling Haaland hat-trick helped the Citizens come back from 2-0 down when they hosted Palace in August, while Liverpool claimed a Premier record-equalling 9-0 win when they faced the Cherries at Anfield. Plus, Everton v Brentford, Leeds United v Brighton & Hove Albion, Leicester City v Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur v Nottingham Forest

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Amy Irons presents action from the opening quarter-finals, featuring Hearts v Celtic at Tynecastle and Inverness Caledonian Thistle v Kilmarnock at Caledonian Stadium

programme.title: Breaking the News
programme.desc: Des Clarke hosts a special edition of panel show Breaking the News, looking back at the past 100 years to celebrate a century of BBC broadcasting from Scotland. Guests Jo Caulfield, Jamie MacDonald, Kaye Adams and Stuart Mitchell join Des to reflect on everything from the Moon landings to Ally's Tartan Army

programme.title: At Any Price (2012)
programme.desc: A farmer strives to grow his family business by any means necessary, but his rebellious youngest son proves a constant disappointment, more interested in pursuing a career as a racing driver than helping with the farm. When a series of crises threaten the family's future, father and son must learn to put aside their differences to avert the disaster. Drama, starring Dennis Quaid and Zac Efron

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley meets Gloucester Cathedral's stonemasons, and Gemma Hunt meets a woman whose recovery from addiction led her to find faith, which helps her to support others

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Matt's antique vibration device is sure to create a buzz in the Bidding Room. Will the bizarre Victorian medical device reach his desired price? Nigel Havers also meets Samantha and Joshua, who are hoping to sell their art deco cinema seat to fund a holiday

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Ireland (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the final match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. After impressive victories over England and Wales, Scotland tasted defeat for the first time in the campaign last time out when they lost 32-21 to France in Paris. That result left Ireland as the one team still in with a chance of the Grand Slam, and they will be hopeful of emulating their 26-5 triumph over the Scots in Dublin last year. With analysis from Martin Johnson, John Barclay, and Tommy Bowe

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith discovers how cuts are affecting management of Dartmoor. She finds out how the major political parties are taking sides over to the right to camp debate, and catches up with author Guy Shrubsole to discover a rare rainforest in the UK. Matt Baker helps conservationists with a bird survey, Adam Henson visits an equine rehab centre, and Paralympian Sammi Kinghorn meets volunteers opening up Dartmoor for everyone. Plus, in the second of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles discovers what it takes to be a hill farmer in Wales

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores British woodland, grassland, freshwater and ocean habitats, revealing the surprising and dramatic wildlife that exist right on the doorstep, the existence of which is critical for the survival of species right across the globe. The first episode examines the benefits of Britain's natural geology and examines ways in which depleted islands can be restored for future generations

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from the grounds of Belmont House in Kent, where she encounters a disguised Michael McIntyre preparing a prank for his Saturday night show. Items brought in to be valued include an early David Hockney painting, a trophy awarded to Take That in 1995, a sword that once belonged to a member of the Dervish religious order, and a telegram announcing the end of the Second World War

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer sets up his timeshare business in Tenerife. When his passport expires, he is warned about his arrest and flees to Brazil. The police find details of a foreign bank account that has been laundering Brink's-Mat proceeds, and Boyce is sent to Switzerland on a mission to learn who controls it. McAvoy dreams up a prison escape plan, while Cooper and Parry are lured into a trap as the money is traced back to them

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from today's Premier League fixtures, including Fulham v Arsenal at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. The Gunners faced a test of their title credentials away to a Fulham side that have impressed this season, while United will have expected three points against the struggling Saints. Plus, Newcastle United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and West Ham United v Aston Villa

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Amy Irons presents action from the quarter-final between Rangers and Raith Rovers at Ibrox. Plus, the key moments from Hearts v Kilmarnock and Inverness Caledonian Thistle v Kilmarnock

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Chelsea v Manchester United, Arsenal v Reading and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Rugby union player Danny Cipriani, W Series World Champion Jamie Chadwick, former Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips and Commonwealth gold medal-winning weightlifter Zoe Smith join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley showcase the work of frontline forces and ask for viewers' help on unsolved cases

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Kent, an officer and his police dog chase down a criminal. A brave PC confronts an armed robber when he enters a restaurant with a knife and a fire-fighter in Leicestershire is assaulted when he tries to put out a garden fire

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin follow the progress of a multi-apartment property in south Wales, a mid-terrace on Merseyside and a ground floor flat in Birmingham

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Brighton Racecourse Antiques Fair, with the help of experts Danny Sebastian and John Cameron, and relives the 1960s with a group of original mods

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Sullivan's dream of leaving Kembleford is scuppered when he is arrested for receiving stolen goods. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring more treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life. Ceramic conservator Kirsten Ramsay carefully restores a cherished but chipped piece of 1960s pottery, but with pieces missing and a highly polished finish to mimic she has her work cut out. A military campaign chest that's been through the wars and two much-loved Dutch chairs in need of caning are also restored

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman embarks on a house-hunting mission in the Shropshire countryside, balancing the dreams of a father who has a £475,000 budget and wants to head for the hills, while his daughter wants him to live closer to a community. Nicki also heads to Wenlock and tries her inexperienced hand at pot-throwing and the Japanese art of raku, a pot-firing technique that produces some dramatic results

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Ishy Balmer visits the first Jain temple in the western world and Izzie Khan discovers the history of folk art. Later, the final auction in Leicestershire, sees broken pineapples, legless glass ladies, mystery board games and an antique pub table - but which items will make the duo some money?

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Intrepid team members Christine, Elaine, Karen and Katie compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Richard Blackwood checks in to the retreat, and soon finds himself tasked with making some chorizo for a French-inspired supper. The B&B's resident chef Alex takes the actor and comedian to meet a local pig farmer with a speciality for charcuterie to help him in his mission. The next day, host Sharon has a special task in mind for her guest. He might be known for his sharp wit, but Sharon wants Richard to sharpen his skills working with a local artisan producer. Can he handle the heat of the blacksmiths forge?

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: The peaceful community of Shipton Abbott is rocked when beloved painting the Solo Mare disappears in a seemingly impossible heist while plans are in motion for its appearance at an exhibition. The theft is even more perplexing given the artwork was under the guard of PC Kelby Hartford at the time. Kelby feels responsible and Humphrey pulls out all the stops to recover the priceless piece. Drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Mooney and the team become embroiled in the mysterious world of faith healing when a blind woman dies while being treated by renowned healer Steadman King. When it turns out the victim was poisoned, all eyes turn to Steadman and his cup of holy water. But how could the prime suspect have carried out the deed in front of an audience without anyone noticing? Meanwhile, JP is put through his paces when Pico the police dog joins the team on a week-long trial, and Florence tries to recreate some of Jack's home comforts

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from today's Premier League fixtures, including Fulham v Arsenal at Craven Cottage and Manchester United v Southampton at St Mary's Stadium. The Gunners faced a test of their title credentials away to a Fulham side that have impressed this season, while United will have expected three points against the struggling Saints. Plus, Newcastle United v Wolverhampton Wanderers and West Ham United v Aston Villa

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: Talking Movies reports from Los Angeles ahead of Hollywood's biggest night of the year - the Oscars. With the sci-fi action comedy Everything Everywhere All at Once leading the Oscars race, the preview programme hears from its Asian star Michelle Yeoh and looks at how this has been a record year for Asian actors in terms of nominations. With Steven Spielberg's semi-autobiographical The Fabelmans up for seven Oscars, Talking Movies also features an interview with the acclaimed Hollywood director on why the film is so important to him. Other big names whose movies are in the running include Cate Blanchett, Brendan Fraser and director James Cameron - they each discuss their Oscar-nominated work with presenter Tom Brook. Also, India's prolific film industry is often overlooked by the Academy, but this year the country has picked up a best original song nomination for its epic action international blockbuster RRR as well as getting recognition in the documentary feature and documentary shor

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: In February 2022, a video emerged of a young Afghan woman screaming for help whilst her door was being kicked in by the Taliban. Little is known about what took place after - where was she taken and for what reason? Yalda Hakim travels to Afghanistan after gaining access to her and her family after they were released from prison and as they plot their escape from Afghanistan to Europe.

programme.desc: After Pip and Posy compete in a wheelbarrow race, they aren’t in a good frame of mind with one another. How will they get over this?

programme.desc: Brush decides to start a ladies club and invites all the ladies of the forest for brunch. When Fox and Tusk try to join in, dressed as ladies, Brush soon discovers their identity

programme.desc: Sophie looks through her magic binoculars to find out how animals boogie

programme.title: Iorram - Boat Song
programme.desc: A cinema documentary entirely in Scottish Gaelic, Iorram (Boat Song) is a lyrical portrait of life in Scotland's Outer Hebrides, past and present. Director Alastair Cole takes the audience on an immersive journey into the heart and soul of a 1000-year-old community, blending archive sound recordings of voices from the past with visuals of island life today and an original score by acclaimed folk musician Aidan O'Rourke. At the core of the film is an extraordinary trove of sound archive, recorded by pioneering Scottish ethnographers in the mid-20th century, who visited the Western Isles to capture the hardship and romance of life lived in precarious balance with the sea. These newly restored recordings preserve an oral history of lore and legends, tall tales and tragedies, passed down through generations of Gaelic speakers. This soundtrack of voices, stories and songs from the past is accompanied by moving imagery of the daily working rhythm of the islands, on land and on water, shot ov

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of both teams' fourth match of the championship, held at Stadio Olimpico. Warren Gatland's side come into this game in desperate need of a morale boosting victory after a turbulent few weeks for Welsh rugby, but they are going up against an Italy side who claimed a historic win against them last year in Cardiff thanks to a late Edoardo Padovani try at the Principality Stadium. Despite losing all of their matches so far, the Azzurri have shown significant signs of improvement and they will be targeting a first home win in this competition since 2013. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Brian O'Driscoll, commentary by Miles Harrison, Shane Williams and Nolli Waterman, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. England have bounced back from an opening day defeat at home to Scotland with wins over Italy and Wales, but this represents a tougher test for Steve Borthwick's men. The French's hopes of a second successive Grand Slam came to an end when they were defeated by Ireland in round two, but wins over the Italians and Scots either side of that setback mean that, like their opponents, they are still in title contention should the Irish slip up. With analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Benjamin Kayser, reports from Martin Bayfield and Maggie Alphonsi and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Italy v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). Jill Douglas presents coverage of both teams' fourth match of the championship, held at Stadio Olimpico. Warren Gatland's side come into this game in desperate need of a morale boosting victory after a turbulent few weeks for Welsh rugby, but they are going up against an Italy side who claimed a historic win against them last year in Cardiff thanks to a late Edoardo Padovani try at the Principality Stadium. Despite losing all of their matches so far, the Azzurri have shown significant signs of improvement and they will be targeting a first home win in this competition since 2013. With analysis from Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Brian O'Driscoll, commentary by Miles Harrison, Shane Williams and Nolli Waterman, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v France (Kick-off 4.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the match in the fourth and penultimate round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. England have bounced back from an opening day defeat at home to Scotland with wins over Italy and Wales, but this represents a tougher test for Steve Borthwick's men. The French's hopes of a second successive Grand Slam came to an end when they were defeated by Ireland in round two, but wins over the Italians and Scots either side of that setback mean that, like their opponents, they are still in title contention should the Irish slip up. With analysis by Jonny Wilkinson, Clive Woodward and Benjamin Kayser, reports from Martin Bayfield and Maggie Alphonsi and commentary by Nick Mullins, Lawrence Dallaglio and Ben Kay

programme.desc: When a successful music producer is murdered, Geordie finds himself implicated in the investigation. Meanwhile, Will is on thin ice with the Bishop, who wants to discuss his future in Grantchester. Could both of their jobs be on the line - and can he save himself as well as his best friend?

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The summer of 1959 finds the wedding season in full swing in the Cambridgeshire village of Grantchester. Among the Reverend Will Davenport's many brides-to-be is Adele Fitzgerald, who lives on the once-splendid, but now declining Fitzgerald Estate with her green-fingered spinster sister Maude. The body of a dead man is found in the grounds and is quickly identified as the sisters' errant brother Lord Edmund Fitzgerald, who has been living an itinerant life travelling the world since the war. Will and DI Geordie Keating find themselves at odds with Geordie's new boss DCI Elliot Wallace and DC Larry Peters in viewing the death as a murder. As Will and Geordie investigate the Fitzgerald family history, they find themselves looking into Edmund's own romantic past. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tessa Peake-Jones and Emma Cunniffe

programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to re-create a Victorian garden in Regent's Park, where they meet all manner of intriguing characters - but the oasis of calm in central London is shattered by the discovery of a body. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A pupil at the prestigious Devington School dies of a stab wound while competing in a race in honour of his recently deceased grandfather. Mystery, starring John Nettles, Daniel Casey and Jane Wymark

programme.desc: Barnaby and Troy investigate the death of amateur artist Ruth Fairfax, whose body has been discovered by Joyce - but the more they delve into the dead woman's background, the more mysterious she becomes. programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The bodies of a glamorous senior citizen and a distinguished doctor are found beside a river - and although suspicion for their murders initially falls on poachers, Barnaby suspects a more monetary motive for the attack. With Honor Blackman, Philip Franks, James Hazeldine and Jeff Rawle

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

Lady Rosamund is eager to unearth Lavinia and Carlisle's secret after overhearing them arguing, and romance blossoms for both Edith and Mary. programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to create a garden as a wedding present, and find a baby under a gooseberry bush. The discovery brings out Rosemary's maternal side as the pair investigate who abandoned the child. Their task is complicated by the murder of an artistic neighbour - and the two mysterious incidents appear to be connected. Starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. When one of the competitors is found dead, everyone assumes it to be a gruesome accident - but there is more to the case than meets the eye. While investigating, Laura enters the mysterious world of bullfighting, and Rosemary rediscovers her love of motor scooters

programme.desc: Documentary exploring the entertainer's rise from poverty to fame, drawing on extracts from an unfinished autobiography. Featuring contributions from friends and colleagues including Michael Barrymore, Janet Street-Porter, Chris Tarrant and Generation Game co-host Isla St Clair

programme.desc: Chrissy and Robin spend an evening at home alone - and the absence of a chaperone allows the trainee chef's amorous side to surface. Comedy, starring Richard O'Sullivan

programme.desc: There is a big night out that causes upset for Victoria and pushes Leyla to react, Laurel takes action, and Marlon wants to help his friend by gathering the men of the village to talk.

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly (1966)
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. Featuring Ennio Morricone's iconic soundtrack

programme.title: Amazing Railway Adventures with Nick Knowles
programme.desc: The presenter experiences the wonders of the world, by train. First, he heads to Mexico, where he travels on a route from the Pacific coastline at Sinaloa through the incredible Copper Canyon to Creel in Chihuahua. Before boarding his train, Nick visits Topolobampo, a coastal port, where freight trains carrying goods to and from container ships join the railway line through the Copper Canyon. Boarding the passenger train next morning, Nick's first stop is the old Spanish fort town of El Fuerte, which claims to be the inspiration for that legendary hero of multiple Hollywood films, Zorro

programme.title: The Killing of JFK: Minute by Minute
programme.desc: A dissection of events around the assassination of President John Kennedy, charting the timelines of head of security Roy Kellerman, Lee Harvey Oswald and Jackie Kennedy. The three perspectives create a multi-layered view of these much-scrutinised days, considering the hard facts and the still fiercely debated unknowns surrounding this historic event. Includes newly released information that J Edgar Hoover knew about Oswald prior to the shooting

programme.title: Conspiracy
programme.desc: Documentary exploring popular conspiracy theories surrounding the Cold War, including how the lies of one man, former head of intelligence for the German army Reinhard Gehlen, moved the world to within hours of nuclear destruction. Theories related to the potential devastation of the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis are also examined, along with suspicions associated with the assassination of Italy's former prime minister Aldo Morro, who some claim was killed not by communist revolutionists but by a sinister underground army created by Nato

programme.title: Britpop: The Music That Changed Britain
programme.desc: Documentary charting the birth, the rise and the fall of the music culture movement that put the focus on Britishness, looking at the intertwining fortunes and rivalries of Blur, Oasis, Suede and Elastica. Suede insiders about how its started with the band's glam-inspired sound and first album, while Alex James and Dave Rowntree of Blur reveal how their band's disastrous first tour of America triggered a reboot and reappraisal that saw them embrace Britishness, culminating in the classic Parklife album

programme.title: Oasis: Live

programme.title: Britain's Favourite 90s Hits
programme.desc: Chart countdown celebrating the biggest-selling singles of the 1990s, as well as the most memorable pop videos, the artists who appeared in them and the stories behind the songs. Boyzone's Shane Lynch, Blur's Alex James, Peter Andre, and Steps' Lee Latchford-Evans share their views of the biggest hits, while Hannah Spearritt from S Club 7 reminisces about her time at the top of the charts and Cliff Richard talks about his big hit Millennium Prayer.

programme.title: The Gypsies Next Door
programme.desc: Documentary following travellers' constant struggle to co-exist with settled communities. Carol and her family cannot understand why her community is so hated and vilified, while local man Arthur is on a mission to understand what brings the travellers into parks and public areas - and Carol's caravan is his first stop. Johnny and his family live in a chalet in Essex but his non-traveller wife Andrea has had enough of feeling ostracised and wants to move back into a normal house

programme.title: The Gypsies Next Door
programme.desc: In the Irish town of Thurles, the council want Barry to move into new housing purpose-built for travellers. But they will not allow him to take his 30 horses. Teenager Scarlett, who lives with her traveller family in Luton, dreams of being a successful model - and non-traveller model Danielle Mason is going to help show her the way

programme.title: World's Busiest Train Stations
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at Flinders Street station in Melbourne, which is not just the busiest and oldest in Australia, but in the whole of the southern hemisphere. The start of the Australian Open tennis tournament means that many more passengers than usual are expected, while the control room braces itself for even more trouble after trespassers are spotted walking on a busy line

programme.title: Strategic Air Command (1955)
programme.desc: A pilot relishes the opportunity to return to the baseball pitch once the Second World War is over. However, his sporting career is put on hold when he's drafted back into the US Air Force and given the opportunity to fly a revolutionary new jet. Drama, starring James Stewart, Frank Lovejoy, Barry Sullivan, Alex Nicol and June Allyson

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny (1954)
programme.desc: US Navy officers rebel against their ship's erratic captain during a violent storm at sea, only to face a court martial back on dry land. However, the crew's actions seem to have been justified when evidence questioning the mental stability of their superior is produced. Second World War drama based on Herman Wouk's novel, starring Humphrey Bogart, Jose Ferrer, Fred MacMurray and Van Johnson

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada (2006)
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: The Banshees of Inisherin Interview Special
programme.desc: The In Bruges team of Colin Farrell, Brendan Gleeson and writer/director Martin McDonagh talk about making their new film together, The Banshees of Inisherin

programme.title: The Revenant (2015)
programme.desc: A frontiersman leading a hunting party through the wilderness is mauled by a bear, and a travelling companion who pledged to stay with him until help comes kills his son and leaves him for dead. Against all odds, the wounded man survives his injuries and embarks on a gruelling quest for revenge that takes him through a harsh landscape. Western, starring an Oscar-winning Leonardo DiCaprio, with Tom Hardy and Domhnall Gleeson

programme.title: Seven Psychopaths (2012)
programme.desc: A writer struggling to complete the script for a movie about psychopathic killers turns to his criminal friends for advice. He ends up getting more than he bargained for when the small-time crooks kidnap a dog that belongs to a gangster, putting all their lives in danger. Comedy thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Sam Rockwell, Christopher Walken and Woody Harrelson

programme.title: Far North (2007)
programme.desc: A woman is driven from her homeland and forced to live an isolated existence with her adopted daughter in the Arctic wilderness. However, their endless solitude is broken when a wounded soldier appears one day from nowhere. The women take him back to their tent - but the newcomer sows seeds of discord, stirring up conflict between the two women. Drama, with Michelle Yeoh, Sean Bean and Michelle Krusiec

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon (2010)
programme.desc: A clumsy Viking boy longs to become a mighty dragon slayer and protect his village from the fearsome flying lizards, but his father thinks he is not up to the task. However, when he sets out to prove his worth, he ends up befriending a dragon, and realises his people may have misjudged the creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler

programme.title: Masters of the Universe (1987)
programme.desc: The heroic warrior He-Man sets out to bring an end to the evil Skeletor's reign of terror, but is transported to Earth by a cosmic key, with his arch enemy's henchman in hot pursuit. Fantasy adventure, starring Dolph Lundgren, Frank Langella, Meg Foster and Billy Barty

programme.title: Puss in Boots (2011)
programme.desc: The swashbuckling feline joins forces with a cunning thief and a treacherous old friend to steal a magical golden goose from a giant's castle. He must save the day when it transpires that their actions have unleashed a terrible danger on his home town. Animated comedy spin-off from the Shrek movies, with the voices of Antonio Banderas and Salma Hayek

programme.title: The Choice (2016)
programme.desc: Two neighbours find themselves overwhelmingly attracted to each other, and make substantial changes in their lives to be together - one breaking off a long-term relationship and the other conquering his fear of commitment. Over the next 10 years, their feelings for each other are tested by a series of challenges. Romantic drama based on Nicholas Sparks' novel, starring Benjamin Walker and Teresa Palmer

programme.title: Maid in Manhattan (2002)
programme.desc: A chambermaid at an exclusive hotel daringly tries on a designer dress belonging to a guest - and is spotted by a wealthy politician, who mistakes her for a socialite and invites her on a date. However, the differences in their social backgrounds soon become apparent and threaten their budding romance. Comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Ralph Fiennes, Natasha Richardson and Bob Hoskins

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan (1998)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Normandy landings, a group of American soldiers scours the battlefields of France in search of a missing infantryman, who has been given compassionate leave to return home because his brothers have been killed in the conflict. Steven Spielberg's Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Tom Hanks, Tom Sizemore, Edward Burns, Matt Damon, Barry Pepper and Vin Diesel. It won five Academy Awards, including Best Cinematography, Best Film Editing, and Best Director. The film makers also took home a couple of Baftas for Best Sound and Best Special Effects

programme.title: Zombieland (2009)
programme.desc: A mutated virus sweeps across America, turning most of the population into hideous flesh-eating zombies. A hard-drinking fearless adventurer leads a small band of young survivors on a perilous journey through the wasteland in search of a safe haven. Comedy horror, with Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg, Emma Stone and Abigail Breslin

programme.title: Caught in Time (2020)
programme.desc: A detective tracks down a gang of criminals a decade after they initially evaded arrest. Lau Ho Leung's action crime thriller, starring Daniel Wu and Qianyuan Wang. In Mandarin with English subtitles

programme.title: It Came from Beneath the Sea (1954)
programme.desc: The captain of a nuclear submarine battles a gigantic octopus threatening to destroy San Francisco. Monster adventure, starring Kenneth Tobey, Faith Domergue and Donald Curtis, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2 (2011)
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa (2008)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals discover a plane and, following a swift repair job by the penguins, manage to escape the desolate shores of Madagascar. However, they crash-land on the plains of Africa and find themselves face-to-face with their wild counterparts for the first time. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Little Women (2019)
programme.desc: In 1868, New York City teacher Jo March goes to Mr Dashwood, an editor who agrees to publish a story she has written. She reflects back and forth on her life, telling the story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms. Writer/director Greta Gerwig's adaptation of the Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson and Florence Pugh

programme.title: Bend It Like Beckham (2002)
programme.desc: An English schoolgirl tries to hide her passion for football from her strict Indian parents, knowing they disapprove of her tomboyish love of the game. However, when a semi-professional player sees her in action, she is offered a place on a team, forcing her to come up with a complex plan to keep her sporting career under wraps. Comedy, with Parminder Nagra, Keira Knightley, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Juliet Stevenson and Shaznay Lewis

programme.title: Terminator: Dark Fate (2019)
programme.desc: An augmented human and Sarah Connor must stop an advanced liquid Terminator named Rev-9 from hunting down a young girl in Mexico City, whose fate is critical to the human race. As the Rev-9 ruthlessly destroys everything and everyone in its path, the three are led to a T-800 from Sarah's past that may be their last best hope. Sci-fi adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton and Mackenzie Davis

programme.title: Vivarium (2019)
programme.desc: Young couple Gemma and Tom are keen to buy their first home together, but when they do, things take a strange turn. Sci-fi thriller starring Jesse Eisenberg and Imogen Poots

programme.title: Carol (2015)
programme.desc: A housewife trapped in a loveless marriage in 1950s New York forms a close attachment with a younger woman seeking fulfilment in her own life. A passionate secret affair develops, but as her husband grows suspicious, she finds her competence as a parent being called into question. Romantic drama based on Patricia Highsmith's novel The Price of Salt, starring Cate Blanchett and Rooney Mara

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: As Tony continues with his internal battle, Darren encourages him to talk to a professional. Elsewhere, Romeo struggles to fix things with Rayne

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Imran confides in Brooke, as the pair reminisce over the past. Meanwhile, a determined Romeo turns to Lacey for help in getting Rayne back

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: In Oregon, Gordon Ramsay tries to rescue the Applegate River Lodge, which is around $1million in debt. The chef questions whether owner Richard Davis's interest in smoking cannabis is distracting him from the problems at this family-built inn, and encounters Richard's sons Duke and Dusty, whose fiery relationship seems to prevent them from working together to tackle the establishment's financial troubles

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: When Caitlin and Shannon meet at the altar for the first time the connection is immediate, while Alyssa and Duncan are instantly smitten by each other

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: While being interviewed for a documentary about Star Trek character Mr Spock, Sheldon struggles to suppress his emotions about his recent break-up with Amy, leaving Leonard and Penny shocked to discover he had bought her an engagement ring. Howard and Bernadette fall out over plans to renovate his childhood home. Wil Wheaton, Adam Nimoy and Stephen Merchant guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is determined to lead the Dolphins to victory in a big football game, showing no mercy to the opposition despite the fact they are playing with an unexpected disadvantage. Off the field, Phil tries to teach his kids about optimism, but nothing seems to be going his way. Meanwhile, at Pritchett Closets & Blinds, Claire is desperate to prove to her colleagues that she is more than just the boss's daughter. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Christmas has arrived, providing a typically chaotic time for the Pritchett-Dunphys, as Jay takes Manny to chop down a tree, Mitchell rushes to finish his shopping and Cam and Lily get into the holiday spirit at a charity event. Meanwhile, Gloria has a visit from her mum. Directed by Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Santiago hosts a Thanksgiving dinner at her apartment for all her colleagues, but the event risks turning into a disaster, especially when Holt and Peralta have to leave in a hurry to catch a thief who has stolen a large sum of money from the evidence lock-up. Can Boyle save the day?

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta is put in charge of Captain Holt's security after he receives several death threats - a responsibility he not only enjoys, but also abuses as much as he can. Santiago tries to encourage her colleagues to take a Christmas photo, only to be met with a lack of enthusiasm - and Diaz's refusal to smile. US cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is fired for being disrespectful to his boss, and explores new activities in a bid to find a purpose in life other than physics, but Leonard takes drastic action to restore him to his old self. Laurie Metcalf guest stars as Sheldon's mother

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard fears he is wasting his time with Penny and ends up spending the night with fellow scientist Leslie. However, he is disappointed when she later tells him she was only interested in a one-night stand. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the friends find out about Bernadette's big news, they celebrate by getting together for an evening of karaoke. However, Bernadette is upset when Howard freaks out over her announcement as he becomes convinced that he needs to start earning more money. Comedy, Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the 200th episode of the comedy, the gang finally celebrates Sheldon's birthday after more than nine years together, with the help of a few special guests. Starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with guest appearances from Adam West, Wil Wheaton and Stephen Hawking

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A day at the museum proves to be anything but fun when Cam, Mitch and Manny realise they can't hold their own against brainbox Alex. Claire is less than enthusiastic when she and Gloria go shopping to buy a dress for Lily, while Jay imparts some manly pearls of wisdom to grandson Luke

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The adults take a trip to Las Vegas, where Jay wheels and deals to get them some better rooms - including their very own British butler, played by Stephen Merchant. Phil spends most of his time with his magician heroes - neglecting Claire in the process - and Mitch runs into an ex-boyfriend he dumped by e-mail, although it all seems fine when he invites Mitch and Cam to his bachelor party

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Boyle asks Peralta to be his best man, but as well as helping out with cake-tasting and choosing invitations, he must also persuade the groom to start standing up to Vivian before the big day. Holt helps Diaz make a sincere apology and Jeffords, Santiago and Gina embark on a tough new diet - but struggle to stick to it

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta enlists Jeffords to help him tackle a cold case that everyone thinks is unsolvable. Meanwhile, Santiago plans a romantic weekend away with her new boyfriend Teddy, and Gina and Diaz tell Boyle one of their best-kept secrets. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Melissa Fumero

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tries to help Sheldon when he starts to wonder whether he is wasting his time studying string theory. Meanwhile, during a dinner, Raj discovers Howard once embarrassed himself on a date with Emily. Stephen Hawking guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny and Leonard try to distract Sheldon from his career woes by reinstating Anything Can Happen Thursday, but it causes friction among the gang when Amy and Bernadette are caught lying. Meanwhile, Raj seeks Howard's help in preparing for a date with Emily. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes fun of Leonard's habit of collecting sci-fi memorabilia, so he decides to give it up - but his friends object and do everything possible to persuade him not to change his ways. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's friends all fall for his sexy twin sister, who is paying him a visit, but he declares he will have the final say on who can date her - an announcement that particularly dismays Leonard. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Peri decides to surprise her girlfriend Juliet with a trip to Brighton. Meanwhile, Norma's devious plan is set into motion, starting with breaking and entering

programme.title: The Farmer Wants a Wife: Australia
programme.desc: Five farmers set out on a quest for true love, with eight women having been invited to come to meet them before they embark on a series of dates

programme.title: What Men Want (2019)
programme.desc: Ali Davis is a successful sports agent who is constantly overlooked by her male colleagues. After her boss tells her that a key reason she didn't get promoted was because she doesn't connect well with men, Ali begins to question what she needs to do to succeed in a man's world. Then everything changes when she gains the ability to hear men's thoughts. Director Adam Shankman's revamp of Mel Gibson's romantic comedy What Women Want, starring Taraji P Henson and Aldis Hodge

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 24-year-old beautician Gemma from West Sussex. She has dated a few love rats and is now searching for her Prince Charming. She is followed by 28-year-old bisexual tattoo artist Jennafer, who is fed up of men and now wants to find the perfect woman. Will any of the contestants be just what Jennafer is looking for?

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of six potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 43-year-old Cathy from Hertfordshire who, with her biological clock ticking, is wanting to settle down and have children. The trouble is she's open to dating men from their 20s to their 60s and finds it hard to choose. Will she find it easier to pick the right partner when they're all naked? Then, 24-year-old Londoner Adam takes centre stage. He hates online dating and has decided to bare all in order to find the perfect match

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Programmes under review include James May: Oh Cook, Strictly Come Dancing, The Crown, I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!, Nigella's Cook, Eat, Repeat, Naked Attraction, and news coverage of Dominic Cummings and Donald Trump

programme.title: The Farmer Wants a Wife: Australia
programme.desc: Five farmers set out on a quest for true love, with eight women having been invited to come to meet them before they embark on a series of dates

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta tries to make a deal with a suspect Diaz has just arrested in an attempt to catch a car thief he has been tracking for years. Boyle's colleagues set out to meet his every need when he returns to work after being shot in the line of duty, and Captain Holt struggles to find a home for two puppies

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Santiago's ongoing bet about who can make the most arrests comes to an embarrassing conclusion, while Boyle receives a medal following the shooting, but his pain medication loosens his tongue and he starts to reveal what he really thinks of his colleagues

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly insists the family take a road trip to go on vacation to Disneyland before Erica and Barry go off to college. Erica worries about her relationship with Geoff when he tells her they need to talk. Comedy, guest starring Christie Brinkley

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: The teams have six hours to create builds that can drag themselves across a high wire for at least 10 metres, then are given 10 hours to complete unfinished cities

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to transform the fortunes of Sebastian's, a pizzeria in Burbank, Los Angeles, which is failing to attract customers, leaving the owner in debt and struggling to support his family. Gordon is horrified to discover pre-processed and frozen ingredients on the menu, but there seems to be little he can do to help when he is thrown out of the kitchen

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: A fresh group of singles embarks on the social experiment, with the first two matched couples being Lyndall and Cameron, and Bronte and Harrison

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Sandy, who has grown up in a traditional Indian family where the community can be involved when making life decisions, is matched with business owner and father Dan

programme.title: Ferdinand (2017)
programme.desc: After a bull with a big heart is mistaken for a dangerous beast, he is captured and torn from his home. Determined to return to his family, he rallies a misfit team on the ultimate adventure. Animated comedy, with the voices of John Cena, Kate McKinnon and Bobby Cannavale

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: An earthquake strikes, leaving Claire stuck in the bathroom with a plumber. Meanwhile, the tremor causes Manny to experience an existential crisis, and Mitchell struggles to remain calm. Comedy, guest starring Nathan Lane (The Producers)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: In an episode inspired by Hitchcock thriller Strangers on a Train, Claire and Mitchell agree to be brutally honest with each other's partners - so Phil is informed his stand-up comedy is cringeworthy, and Cam is told his decision to wear biker shorts is unwise. Comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Tired of the family's obsession with electronic gadgets, Claire and Phil declare a household challenge to see who can stay unplugged the longest. Mitch and Cameron frantically try to get Lily into the best pre-school, while Jay and Manny are concerned at the lengths to which Gloria will go to stop the neighbour's dog barking

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire prepares the Dunphy household for Halloween, but the rest of the family is less enthusiastic. The spooky goings-on remind Cameron of a traumatic childhood experience, and Gloria is upset when Jay and Manny make fun of her accent

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: While Claire and Haley fall ill at the same time, Phil wages battle against a defective smoke detector after concluding it is saying 'you're not a man' to him. Elsewhere, Manny accidentally gets one of Jay's employees dismissed. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Julie Bowen

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes an important decision after Leonard tries to help her in the aftermath of a failed role on a TV show. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart practise talking to strangers at a shopping centre, and Sheldon studies to become a comic genius. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984)
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist, with his young sidekick and a nightclub singer in tow, is stranded in India, where he takes on a mission to recover magical sacred stones from the hands of an evil cult engaged in human sacrifice and child slavery. Steven Spielberg's action adventure, starring Harrison Ford, Kate Capshaw, Ke Huy Quan and Amrish Puri

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Nick and Liv Grimshaw, Denise van Outen and Eddie Boxshall, Mo Gilligan and Babatunde Aleshe, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Martin and Roman Kemp, Gyles Brandreth and Maureen Lipman, Iain Stirling and Laura Whitmore, Sunetra Sarker and Georgia Taylor, Lorraine Kelly and Rosie Smith, Melanie C and her brother Paul, Clare Balding and Alice Arnold, Chris Eubank Sr and Chris Eubank Jr, and Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford appraise shows including Clarkson's Farm, Snakes on a Plane, Fresh, Fried and Crispy, Lupin, 10 Years Younger in 10 Days and Tiny World. programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: First Dates

Will it be second time lucky when they meet Becca and Shannon? Meanwhile, it may be tough finding love for people wrapped up in the nine to five, but young professionals Louisa and Cameron leave thoughts of the daily grind at the door when they meet for their date, and 42-year-old Dan and 39-year-old Adam hope to find that certain spark

programme.title: First Dates

Dean's dream of dating a redhead looks set to become true when he meets flame-haired estate agent Kate, while 49-year-old Thomas - whose last date ended in heartbreak - is hoping it will be second time lucky when he sits down with sexual health nurse Colin

Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, the third instalment in the successful franchise. Harrison Ford stars as the titular hero, alongside Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: The Inbetweeners 2 (2014)
programme.desc: Awkward teenagers Will, Simon and Neil find university life does not live up to their expectations, and are insanely jealous of Jay's stories of his gap year in Australia. Heading Down Under to meet their friend, they inevitably discover he has exaggerated his escapades - so decide to go in search of a real adventure. Comedy sequel, starring Simon Bird, James Buckley, Joe Thomas and Blake Harrison

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The gang goes on the infamous sociology and geography field trip to Swanage, during which Neil tries his hardest to avoid the advances of over-friendly teacher Mr Kennedy. Meanwhile, Will takes a shine to new girl Lauren - but she is only interested in Simon. Comedy, starring Simon Bird

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will is unhappy about being forced by Mr Gilbert to take a work experience job at a garage due to a mix-up that sees Neil joining a newspaper. Meanwhile, Jay sorts out a placement for himself and Simon at his father's plant hire company. Starring Simon Bird and Blake Harrison

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will plans to celebrate his birthday with a grown-up dinner, but his friends face a dilemma when they discover the event clashes with a more popular party. They end up gatecrashing the rival gathering, only to find that Simon's French exchange student steals the limelight

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will tries to reinvent the boys' image by taking them clubbing around London, but Simon is unsure whether to go until Carli shows an interest in the outing. When the friends arrive in the West End, their efforts to appear cool are hampered by aggressive bouncers, a tramp and some angry bus passengers

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will is asked to help co-ordinate the school's Duke of Edinburgh award scheme, but instead of carrying out his duties, he turns the situation to his advantage and tries to flirt with a university student. Meanwhile, Simon faces problems when his parents separate. Simon Bird and Joe Thomas star

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will becomes stressed as the friends prepare for their exams - apart from Jay, who finds himself preoccupied. Simon makes progress with Carli by helping her revise, and they all reminisce about the events of the past year. Comedy, starring Simon Bird

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The gang goes on the infamous sociology and geography field trip to Swanage, during which Neil tries his hardest to avoid the advances of over-friendly teacher Mr Kennedy. Meanwhile, Will takes a shine to new girl Lauren - but she is only interested in Simon. Comedy, starring Simon Bird

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: A plea hearing prompts true feelings to rise to the surface, while things go from bad to worse for Romeo when he wrongly accuses his crush of sleeping with his best friend

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp introduces new crafts, skills and techniques for interior decoration. In this edition, she reveals how to create a personalised doormat and coasters, using spray paint, old tiles and serviettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Cornwall couple Marc and Matt fell in love with Majorca the moment they stepped onto the island six years ago and are now looking to buy their very own holiday retreat that they can escape to at a moments notice. Armed with a budget of £200,000, Ben Hillman tries to find them their dream pad in the perfect location

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the season draws to a close for the Brits abroad, the owners of a glampsite in Portugal get hands-on at a goat farm. In France, two Brits attempt to host a wine-tasting night. Meanwhile, at a riding centre, a mother and daughter have cause to celebrate

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. Henry is barn searching on his doorstep in Oxfordshire, while Simon makes the long journey down from Liverpool. It's a 'tank off!' as Simon hatches a wacky plan to turn some old tanks into a pizza oven, while Henry turns a redundant water tank into a mobile shelving unit

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. The boys head east to Suffolk to meet Margaret - an avid collector and former mayor - so need to be on their best behaviour

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A new lead opens up on a case that has been unsolved for 24 years - but will it be the clue the heir hunters have been waiting for? Meanwhile, the search for heirs of a Romford woman reveals a link to the story that inspired the film Made in Dagenham. Plus, details of two unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent, where James Tindall and Jessica Walton hope to impress their guests and be named best value for money

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, boasting stylish shepherd huts, and run by mother and daughter duo Amanda Benton and Becci Howlett

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The White House in Swansea, where guests James and Jessica have an unusual toilet encounter in their room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. The Ship Inn is up first, with managers James Tindall and Jessica Walton wanting to let off steam about the surprise comments that made their visit a heated affair

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting to help one family and one pair of first-time buyers navigate the Bristol market. Kirstie's poker-loving couple, Liz and Ben, want to buy in their beloved Clifton where they have been renting. Meanwhile, Phil's searching for Greg and Joanna, who want to find a property in a family-friendly area within walking distance of daughter Oliwia's new school

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back on two period properties that desperately needed to be adapted for modern-day living. They meet the Sarah and Ian Renard in Brixworth, Northamptonshire. With one toddler and two dogs to house, this two-bed rural semi is bursting at the seams and Ian wants out. There's only one thing stopping him: Sarah, who is determined to stay and convinced that the house still has the potential to cater for a growing family. They also meet Graham and his partner Ryan who have been fighting over their 17th-century cottage in Cranleigh for years. Charming though it may be, it does not offer the space the two of them now need

programme.title: Crufts 2023
programme.desc: Further coverage from the NEC in Birmingham. Dogs in all shapes and sizes climb, weave and jump over obstacles at top speed on the Agility course in the main arena. Frank Kane continues his tour of British breeds with the much-loved Welsh corgi, while the latest candidate for the Kennel Club's 'Hero Dog' competition is revealed

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in the South Wales Valleys, where sisters Carly and Holly ask them to dig out some treasure from their father's unwanted collection of furniture

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge. Judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller have a tough choice deciding who will go through to the following week's grand finale

programme.title: The Wall: Cover Your Tracks
programme.desc: A new disappearance worries the police so Celine sends out a search party. Meanwhile, the runaways are tracked and found, and a troubling confession follows. Mystery drama, starring Isabel Richer. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The emergency room documentary continues, highlighting the stories of people facing adversity head-on. Erin, a 61-year-old former cancer patient with an ear infection, is rushed to St George's Hospital after she collapsed at home. Doctors fear the condition may have spread to her brain, and send her for a CT scan to find out more. Tony, a 70-year-old part-time DJ, arrives in A&E after being involved in a high-speed bicycle accident while training for a 100-mile charity bike ride, and Charlie, a 39-year-old cabin crew worker, turns up at the hospital complaining of unbearable pain after discharging himself during a previous visit, and removing the cast fitted to support his broken arm

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary detailing the daily work of staff at St George's Hospital in south-west London continues, this time highlighting the stories of patients who received support from loved ones when life became tough. Gerald, a 66-year-old lifeguard and polo club official is rushed into A&E, having sustained a serious head wound after a 10-foot fall. The friends and family of 55-year-old Beverly gather at the hospital when she is admitted with a broken leg after being hit by a car near her home, and Paul, a 39-year-old father-of-three, arrives in resus with a nasty cut to his right arm. Paul complains that he is unable to move his fingers, leading staff to believe be may have significant tendon or nerve damage that could leave him permanently unable to use his hand

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics in Birmingham try to stop hypothermia from setting in when a woman collapses in the snow. At the same time, Mark and Adi attend to a woman whose waters may have broken at 27 weeks and could be hours away from giving birth. In Coventry, crewmates Neil and Laura treat an elderly man who has a life-threatening infection

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The emergency room documentary continues, highlighting the stories of people facing adversity head-on. programme.title: A Place in the Sun

The couple have their hearts set on a new build property and have asked Laura Hamilton to help find them the perfect one. Laura lines up various options for their maximum budget of £260,000, but will any impress them enough to make an offer?

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates shock reports that changing sea temperatures mean squid and chips could one day replace fish and chips as the UK's national dish, and heads to Thailand, where squid is a national obsession. Kate Quilton goes Down Under to find out about a surprising new meat coming into our supermarkets and Matt Tebbutt heads to Italy to find out how supermarkets can sell pesto at an affordable price when the traditional ingredients are famously expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Terry and Kay Hodges are looking for a second home where they can spend family holidays with their two young children. Danni Menzies finds five beautiful properties on the Costa Almería in southern Spain

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Bernie and George Wilks, who have sold their house in the UK and want to start a new adventure living in the Spanish area of Oliva, on a budget of £75,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jacqui Lockhart has worked hard all her life, and now that she has the savings available she wants to fulfil her lifelong dream of owning a holiday home on Spain's southern Costa Blanca. With a cash budget of £50,000 and the support of her daughter Judy, the pressure is on for Danni Menzies to help Jacqui secure her dream property

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Two sets of house-hunters look for properties in north London. Kirstie Allsopp is with single mum and businesswoman Digi, who has £1.25million to find the perfect place for her, daughter Emily and mum Queelan. However, it soon proves a challenge to find the family home that suits all their needs. Phil Spencer helps Rebecca and Sohail, who have raised their family in rented accommodation and now want a place of their own now. The problem is finding a place they will love when their rental is worth at least £200,000 more than their budget to buy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Ray Dodd hosts the first dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but finds his guests a difficult crowd to please. Recruitment executive Michelle Watson turns her nose up at the salmon starter, while choir director Joseph Benneh sends his steak back to the kitchen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
