He hopes his exotic menu of zebra steak and 'elephant dung surprise' will please his guests, but after the insults of the previous night he faces a difficult challenge to persuade his fellow diners to get along

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

She also demonstrates her skills with an accordion and gives her guests an origami masterclass, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Grove Barn B&B in Denton, Norfolk, where owners Steph and Alan Flight hope that their approach to cleanliness will lead to good feedback from their guests. However, visitors Scott and Alistair make a discovery in the bathroom that leaves them with a sinking feeling. And there's confusion in the kitchen at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Moran's B&B in Westward Ho!, Devon, owned by ultra-chic retirees John and Jaqueline, although the lack of an en-suite does not impress Christine and Ian

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: With building works banned and builders doubling as speedboat drivers in the summer, Sara's build is under pressure with just five weeks till the Greek tourist season begins

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Amateur footage and eyewitness accounts telling the story of the earthquake and subsequent tsunami that caused devastation in Japan in March 2011. The film also discovers how the country dealt with the aftermath of these natural disasters, as people struggled to rebuild their lives and communities

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The 100th episode of the series focuses on the love between patients and their nearest and dearest. Sir John Cockburn, who's 89, arrives at St George's with acute abdominal pain and medics think it could be an abdominal aortic aneurysm and he faces emergency surgery. Meanwhile, 68-year-old Mick and his wife Linda have been involved in a head-on car crash. Mick took the brunt of the impact and has multiple injuries from top to toe that could be life-changing. The couple fell in love after leaving previous relationships, making a happy life together in their mobile home. And 10-year-old Niall is brought to A&E after falling 8ft from a tree on a family picnic. He's broken his arm so badly it looks like a banana, and orthopaedic doctors need to work out how to get it back in place

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old motorcyclist Sam is airlifted to St George's after crashing into a bus and being thrown under a car. He is placed in an induced coma and CT scans reveal Sam has bruising to his lungs, a ruptured kidney, a broken thigh bone and a fractured spine. The priority of the medics is is to stop his internal bleeding, while Sam's parents are rushed to the hospital by police. Meanwhile, seven-year-old Raheem arrives in A&E with his dad Dennis after cutting his wrist while playing at home, and 59-year-old Therese turns up with a painful lump on her finger

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and Henning Wehn compete against Jon Richardson and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Tom Allen joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters with 'help' from Joe Wilkinson

George returns to find out whether they have managed to finish the property to the same exceptional standards

George's challenge is to turn a grand drawing room with sea views into a cool, elegant kitchen-diner and create rich, opulent schemes for a bedroom and study. In Manchester, he tackles a 1930s semi-detached where the compact dimensions are proving a headache. With only a tiny budget to work with, can he make a cramped galley kitchen both functional and beautiful?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Multiple business owner Rob Spicer welcomes the diners to his home for the second party in Liverpool. He is convinced his 'historical leader' theme will be a hit, but there is a shock in store as one of the guests reveals a secret about herself

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at BnB at 43 in Richmond, North Yorkshire, where Jenny and Johnny Hatch hope their guests will enjoy a home-from-home experience

programme.desc: Student Emma Davies hosts the fourth dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, hoping to woo her guests with a creative menu featuring stuffed pork and a home-made gnocchi starter as well as treating them to a musical performance

programme.desc: Hypnotherapist Russell Stubbs hosts the final dinner party in Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire, hoping to impress his guests with a rock-night theme. In a bid to improve his chances of claiming the £1,000 prize, he prepares a meal using British produce, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio try to make train travel cheaper, faster and more interesting, replacing the locomotive with a specially modified car and the carriages with a series of caravans. programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the rich and diverse history of West Penwith, the farthest point west in mainland Britain. He visits Lamorna Cove, made famous through song and art, and the Unesco-protected tin and copper mining area of Botallack, where he talks to a mining explorer. The chef also follows an ancient track in search of Cornwall's oldest building and reveals how, as a young lad on the Lizard Peninsula, he fell in love for the first time and tasted his first French fish stew - known as a bouillabaisse

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: As the chef's Cornish odyssey nears its end, he takes a break in the city of Truro, where he discovers an unusual ghost story and tours the magnificent cathedral. He also meets a family passionate about offal, who prepare Rick a meal of pickled ox tongue and beef heart tacos, and in the county's most northerly parish he tells the story of an eccentric vicar who would retrieve the bodies from nearby shipwrecks and bury them in his church graveyard

programme.title: Survivor South Africa

programme.desc: Gym worker Toria hosts the third party in Liverpool, and hopes a kissing game around the dinner table, along with her flaky flapjacks, will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Undergraduate Inzy is the fourth host in Liverpool, and he is on a mission to prove students really can cook. The flirting between him and Toria continues, but will he allow love to stand in way of the competition?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: With their children flying the nest, Andy and Alida have decided now is the time to fulfil their dream of buying a chalet in the French Alps. They are downsizing their house in Wokingham, Surrey, and splitting the funds between the UK and France, so Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin have been sent on a joint mission. With a total of £650,000 to spend, and three shots each to find the perfect property - Laura in Berkshire and Jonnie in the ski-resort of Morzine - the pressure is really on for both of them to deliver

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Linda and Alan Keir, who want to buy a holiday home in the Costa del Sol to escape the climate of the Scottish Highlands. They look at five properties on their budget of £150,000

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Across Britain, more than 600,000 buildings lie unused and unloved, and nearly a third of them are commercial. Architect George Clarke follows people as they attempt to breathe new life into these properties. First up are Cornwall couple Richard and Sarah, who bought their former local high street bank for £50,000 and now face the challenge of converting the Victorian grade II-listed building into a unique family home

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A doctor shares his story of leaving his family and newborn child during lockdown to keep them safe. An 11-year-old hit by a car shows signs of possible internal bleeding, and a 60-year-old woman is injured after tripping over her cat. A footballer being treated for injuries to his achilles tendon describes how the sport has been an escape for him during his childhood in south London

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc: Kathy Burke contemplates if she should fight or accept old age and asks if it's easier or harder to be young in today's world by speaking to some ordinary people with extraordinary lives. In the first of this two-part special, Kathy examines getting older and how she feels about what is to come in later life, she learns from 85 year-old model Bridget and a 70 year-old dominatrix that raging against the realities that come with old age might be the secret to aging disgracefully and with dignity. Featuring contributions from Bill Bailey and Jennifer Saunders

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
programme.desc: Faded television actor Rick Dalton and his stunt double Cliff Booth strive to hang on to their careers during the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles. As they navigate a changing film industry they barely recognise any more, they are drawn into the orbit of both ill-fated rising star Sharon Tate, and Charles Manson and his cult of zealous followers. Drama from director Quentin Tarantino, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Brad Pitt, Margot Robbie, Timothy Olyphant and Al Pacino

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Psychotic Sideshow Bob is released from Springfield Penitentiary thirsting for revenge - prompting Bart and the rest of the family to join the witness protection programme. Featuring the guest voice of Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first of five dinner parties from Leeds. Dog lover Jill is hoping her simple vegan menu will fare well with her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Acting lecturer Sophia hosts the second night in Leeds and hopes her homage to her Mediterranean heritage will win over her guests. With poetry performances, beatboxing and some impromptu acting her night is set to be a success, but will her cooking skills be enough to put her on top?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chilli paste entrepreneur Will serves up a Malaysian menu with homemade sauces. Along with some dodgy dancing and unusual instruments, he hopes to take the number one spot. Sophia and Jill come up with some interesting inventions and Satty embraces Malaysian culture by eating with her hands

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the fourth evening in Leeds, IT consultant Mark looks to charm his guests with his Italian-themed menu. Mark divulges his love for cycling, but leaves his guests feeling a little deflated. His mountain of mash impresses acting tutor Sophia, however marketing manager Satty is unhappy with the impromptu bike race

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Last to host in Leeds is marketing manager Satty, who's planning to bowl her guests over with a Bollywood bonanza. There's a cutting comparison over the starter, some fiery back and forth over the main and some dubious dance moves, as Satty serves up a storm hoping to claim the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with a father and daughter horse riding duo in Italy, who need to think on their feet if they are to survive another hot Italian summer. Marc and Natalia's paddleboarding business in Spain branches out into new territory, and on the Costa Blanca, Dan, Rik and Rex have their dreams of owning a gin distillery dashed

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Ali tries to keep her Spanish dream alive with a new business plan and Christine and Pete are having second thoughts just a year after opening their restaurant. In France, gite owners Lee and Zandra have their sights set on expansion

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Former B&B owner Louisa has dreams of running a holiday rental business on the Costa del Sol. Richard and Eileen host an outdoor wedding in 40 degree heat in France and ice cream makers Chris and Ariane consider hanging up their aprons for good

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Communications director Kath and graphic designer Charlotte from east London cannot wait to escape their busy city lives by buying a Spanish holiday home around the stunning mountains of the Sierra Nevada, where it's possible to sunbathe on the beach and go skiing, all in the same day. Danni Menzies finds five options for their £120,000 budget, but will any wow them enough to want to put in an offer?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lou and Tony dream of buying their own Spanish holiday home to enjoy with all their family. They're looking for a house with great views and lots of outdoor space for Tony to exercise his green fingers on the Canary island of Tenerife. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties for their budget of £350,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: After a long-term relationship came to an end and her son flew the nest, Alix Sinclare sold her family home in Devon. She's now looking for the perfect place to start a new life but cannot decide between current home in Teignmouth, Devon, and Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin offer advice, with Jonnie anxious to convince her that Spain is the place to be

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Michelle and Charlotte from Stevenage are looking for Michelle's dream holiday home on Lanzarote. As a family of four, they have been coming to the island for more than 10 years and feel particularly at home in the seaside town of Playa Blanca. Ben Hillman lines up five properties for their £110,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Recently retired couple Nick and Jane Purser are looking forward to settling down, but cannot decide where that should be. Jane's mother lives in Liverpool, so she would prefer to stay close by with a move to Lancaster. Nick wants them to move to southern France, where he can ride his motorbike in the sun. Jasmine Harman shows the pair three properties in Lancaster for up to £180,000 and Jonnie Irwin tempts them with three properties for up to £145,000 in France

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kent couple Alison and Lee are making a permanent move to the stunning countryside of Albox in Almería. They need a garden that's secure enough for their four dogs to roam safely, and the property must be big enough to host their six grown-up children and three grandchildren. Ben Hillman lines up some impressive properties for their budget of £150,000

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back on two very different downstairs dilemmas, with one family surrendering their space to pets and another struggling to entertain the community they serve. Newly-weds Matt and Lucia struggled to fit their family into their living space as most of it had been given to their rescued pets, while Baptist minister Chris and Caroline had a severe lack of space in an already-extended property as they regularly host upwards of 14 people in their four-bed home

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud visits a couple planning to build a home that looks like a work of art overlooking a valley in south Devon. Joe and Claire's new home will be a giant sculpture inspired by the local landscape, 70 metres long and featuring 34 enormous angled zinc shards jutting out in all directions. It will also be complicated to build and equally as expensive. And although Joe is wealthy, ambitious and fearless, his team quickly come up against problems and the budget virtually doubles the first walls go up. Is his dream home in danger of become a nightmare?

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. The first episode looks back at the singer's early career, and unearths the reasons he felt compelled to remain in the closet in the first place. Featuring contributions from former manager Simon Napier-Bell and Rev Richard Coles, who recalls his own experiences of being a gay man and a pop star in the 1980s

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part two of two. How George Michael announced his sexuality to the world in 1998 and the events that led to it including losing his partner to an Aids-related illness, being arrested for committing a lewd act in a public toilet and threats from the News of the World to publish pictures of him cruising in a park. Will Young shares how the events gave hope to young gay men at the time

programme.title: All the Money in the World (2017)
programme.desc: When 16-year-old John Paul Getty III is kidnapped in 1973, his devoted mother tries to convince his billionaire grandfather Jean Paul Getty to pay the ransom. Ridley Scott's fact-based drama, starring Michelle Williams, an Oscar-nominated Christopher Plummer, who replaced Kevin Spacey a few weeks before the film was released, and Mark Wahlberg

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?

A family from Hull are on the move again, but it remains to be seen whether Jacqui and Steve's new French property will be their 'forever home'

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: In France, gîte owners Jonathan and Linda cook up a new idea. On the French Riviera, Bristolian Matt's water sports activity company tries to keep up with current trends. Meanwhile, in Spain, Chris and Klara try to get their bike rentals business back on its feet after being crushed by the Covid pandemic

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Cedarwood Holidays in St Keverne, Cornwall, where married couple Kirstie and Joe hope their glamping experience will leave the B&Bers green with envy. The guests are pleased with their pristine pods, and the chance to feed seals at a local wildlife sanctuary goes down a treat

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers are still in Cornwall for the week's second visit, at The Llawnroc Hotel, where former Redcoats Craig and Rachel know what it takes to keep their guests entertained

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers spend a third consecutive visit in Cornwall, at ex-military man Jo's The Olde Malthouse in Tintagel, where a number of B&Bers are wowed by the heritage charm

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week takes the B&Bers to Sherborne in Dorset, and The Britannia Inn, run by husband-and-wife team Lee and Hannah. Doubts about the décor get things off to a bad start for a handful of guests, while the controversial pricing at breakfast leaves Kirstie questioning whether she's getting enough bang for her buck

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Kirstie and Joe from Cedarwood Holidays want to know why not all of their guests would return to their place, before Craig and Rachel ask why not a single B&Ber would choose to stay at theirs again. Jo from The Olde Malthouse is keen to mop up his cleanliness complaints, while Hannah and Lee from The Britannia Inn have a gripe with Jo in particular. They then learn the identity of the winner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Postal workers Linda and Andy from Leicestershire are hanging up their mailbags to relocate to the sun-kissed coast of western Cyprus. Jonnie Irwin has five options lined up for their £120,000 budget, but will any have the couple ready to put in an offer?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: When her partner of 20 years died, Ginny Lunn decided to find a holiday home where she could create new memories. Torn between buying a place in Dorset within easy reach of her London home for a budget of £250,000, and the Costa Tropical in Spain, where she would have a budget of £150,000, she requires help. Jasmine Harman shows her three options in Dorset, and Laura Hamilton tries to impress her with three properties in Spain, but, with the help of her sister Sara, which one will Ginny choose?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jackie and Kevin Harper have been holidaying in Barbados for over 30 years with their four children, and have now decided that the time is right to buy their own holiday home on the island they love. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties in the west of Barbados for their £300,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Juliette and Jonathan Cottam are selling their London home to retire elsewhere, but are torn between two very different locations. Juliette dreams of a life in France, where she spent much of her childhood. With a budget of £250,000, she thinks the Dordogne region would be the perfect location. Jonathan wants to stay in the UK with a budget of up to £350,000 and move to Devon where he grew up. Jasmine Harman tempts Juliette with three properties in Devon, while Lara Hamilton shows them three fantastic French homes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jason and Lindsay Crossland from East Yorkshire met 28 years ago when they were working for the RAF. Lindsay suffers from osteoarthritis, which affects her mobility, and as warm sunshine helps her condition their dream is to spend every school holiday in Florida with their son before eventually retiring there. They have a budget of up to £180,000, but will Ben Hillman be able to find them what they're looking for?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newly married Brian and Wendy Woods from Somerset are looking to buy their dream home on the beautiful island of Tenerife. Brian has been holidaying in the canaries for over 30 years, and since he met Wendy 10 years ago the couple have been dreaming about relocating to their favourite island permanently. Armed with a budget of £180,000 Laura Hamilton locates five properties from them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman heads to the Charente region of France to help a couple find a holiday home to enjoy with their children and grandchildren. For their budget of £250,000, Sarah and Greg would like a traditional French cottage or converted barn with four bedrooms in a rural location

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer offer their expert advice to more potential homeowners. In Oxfordshire, first-time buyer Tim hopes Kirstie can put an end to his two-year search for a flat, while globetrotting couple Phil and Louise have decided to settle in Gloucestershire with their baby daughter Annabelle, enlisting Phil's help to find a suitable property

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary looking back at some of some of Noel Fitzpatrick's most memorable cases involving puppies and catching up with the animals at the heart of the stories. Four-month-old West Highland terrier Rodney had been born without back feet, while bulldog Chica required urgent surgery to repair a serious elbow fracture, and Rottweiler Elvis was given a unique spinal implant developed by Noel

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary set inside Woodgreen animal charity. Londoners Roshni and Jay meet two very different dogs - Bella the confident, playful Staffie, and Cech the shy but cuddly terrier. Bella seems to warm to Jay, but it's Roshni who has the final say. Olivia the blind spaniel is looking for a home and funeral workers Amy and Alex want to rescue a dog in need

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Daily life inside Woodgreen animal charity, following staff who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. Patch the border collie displays an impressive array of tricks to try to convince horse groomer Megan that he's a smart choice for her. Pebbles the Lhasa is a firm sofa addict and a bit on the chunky side. She's matched with David, a Paralympian and workaholic

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Siobhán McSweeney hosts the grand final, with the three remaining contestants faced with two of their toughest challenges yet; - to create a stacking, pyramid vase centrepiece and a sgraffito globe. Judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller face their hardest decision yet, as they decide which potter will be crowned the winner

The victims of a hit-and-run incident report a man who denies he was at the wheel

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers are on the look-out for a car linked to the theft of two motorbikes, but when they spot the vehicle parked up and it immediately races off forcing them into a chase. With stingers at the ready, it's not long before the getaway car's tyres are shredded and the suspects abandon the car and go on the run

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: An officer is nearly run over by a desperate driver, and another's patience is tested by a drunken motorist. Plus, a law enforcer goes in search of a suspicious character, and a group of youths tries to deceive the interception unit

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A helicopter is used in the pursuit of an armed robber, ending in a serious accident. Plus, new recruits at South Yorkshire's Road Crime Unit are put to the test by a pair of suspected burglars

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team closes in on a suspected petrol thief, stops a motorist with a stash of suspicious goods in his boot, and tracks a motorist who heads to the fair after ditching his car. programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces across the UK to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to fight the huge rise in street crime. In London, the Met's robbery squads work the streets on a busy Friday night, and with criminals now using motorbikes to get away, cameras help officers identify, track and apprehend offenders. Nick also finds out how pickpockets, scammers and bag thieves use sleight of hand and distraction to relieve people of their valuables

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In Essex, the crew at Walton and Frinton gets an unusual mayday call to a ship called HMS Pickle. Arriving on scene, they discover it is not the modern naval vessel they expected, but a replica of a ship that once served in Nelson's fleet, and though the original survived the battle of Trafalgar, this one is shipping water and sinking fast. On the east coast of Scotland, the crew at Anstruther faces a tricky rescue trying to extract a walker with a badly broken leg from a remote coastal path. And in the Shannon basin in Ireland, the volunteers at one of the RNLI's few inland stations at Lough Derg are woken in the early hours of the morning by their pagers - cries for help have been heard coming from the 40-mile-long lake. After launching into inky darkness and thick fog, the crew make an eerie discovery

Chris Hodson and Jonathan Smith fell in love with the old building with their hearts rather their heads, and five months in the pair now realise the amount of work needed to bring the hotel into the 21st century. Alex arrives a night early to find a cluttered, dark decor with no one on reception and quickly realises she needs to help motivate Chris to change the way he manages his team. Can she reverse decades of ugly decor, teach her hosts to clear the clutter, erase the oppressive red and herald a more glamorous, curated look?

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.desc: Bob Cratchit fights to clear his name to enable him to return home in time for his daughter's wedding, however the evidence is stacked up against him. Meanwhile, Compeyson's behaviour leaves Amelia feeling confused but intrigued. Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili star in this period drama, which re-imagines the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales, set in a fictional version of 19th century London

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Trudi struggles to accept that Paul is still alive, but her shock turns to anger when he lets himself into the house, and Hari gives Siobhan a stark choice - him or the baby. Katie faces her hearing, refusing to deny her relationship with John any longer, and though Alex turns up at Jessica's flat, a declaration of love does not lead to a birthday reconciliation

programme.title: Elvis and Anabelle (2007)
programme.desc: A contestant drops dead in the middle of a beauty pageant, but miraculously returns to life on the mortician's slab. She forms an immediate bond with the jaded young man who was about to embalm her, and together they set off to pursue a new life away from their domineering parents. Romantic fantasy, starring Max Minghella and Blake Lively

programme.desc: A rookie cop interviews imprisoned cannibal Dr Genghis. At the same time, a man obsessed with serial killers records a video diary. Starring Adrian Edmondson

programme.title: Cranford
